body:
# How could creating a time audit equip me to change my life?
- [ ] help me to see the weakness of my memory
- [ ] help me to see "me" as a continuous person backwards, even if the present me feels more real to me (e.g. can I have compassion for my past self? Can I dishonor my past self? What is the relationship of me to me on a timeline?)
- [ ] help me to see where meaningfulness that will express later is truly being worked on in the present
- [ ] help me to see where meaninglessness is happening in my choices because meaningfulness can't express later as a result of the presently meaningless actions I've taken
- [ ] help me to see how little time I have left for multi phased long term goals that can't be rushed OR dropped and pcked back up later (e.g. growing a tropical fruit tree from seed in zone 8, training/raising up a righteous child)

## how do you make a time audit? 

1. write out everything you did (be detailed. The more detailed the better) for a specific span of time (An hour, half a day, a day, a week, a month ; a week with daily details is the most doable with details but a month is better for increased usefulness of the time audit) 
- for memory's sake ask yourself **HOW MANY TIMES DID I...**: 
- eat? 
- prepare and drink water?
- prepare and drink other drinks?
- go fetch items for drinks and food (include grocery shops but also include going to fridge)
- prepare, Cook food?
- clean up after food? 
- clean up for some other reason? What reason? 
- go to the bathroom? 
- have sex? 
- clothe myself? 
- look for clothes? 
- Wash dry fold put away clothes?
- rearrange storage of clothes?
- get more clothes? 
- fix, build on, rearrange, clean living space/ house? Why? Which parts of living space? 
- work garden, yard, land? Which parts? Why? 
- do/work produce and income jobs? Sell things, work things to produce return of Earth (work to produce a return of tools (money is a tool), jobs, land, housing, clothing, water food)? Why
- create art/arranged-Earthscapes to memorialize beauty in your life? Why? Why not? 
- FaceTime a spouse? A child? A house mate? A synagogue mate?? A temple mate? A kin with duty relative? A lost person or person in community? Particularly POOWAD?
# **GONNA WORK ON THIS LIST OF QUESTIONS MORE**


## what is a time audit?

"Construction was funded by the opulent spoils taken from the Jewish Temple after the First Jewishâ€“Roman War in 70 AD led to the Siege of Jerusalem. According to a reconstructed inscription found on the site, "the emperor Vespasian ordered this new amphitheatre to be erected from his general's share of the booty." It is often assumed, as it is with many other Roman projects at the time, that slaves and prisoners of war were brought back to Rome and contributed to the massive workforce needed for the construction of the amphitheater.[19] "

body:
# Why are there nine ashreis instead of 10? Numbering of the 9 ashreis?
Yeshua is the glory on the mountain speaking to his 12 tribes giving them his Torah from heaven for life. Why are there only nine of these words? Where is the 10th? Should they not be numbered by the presence of blessed?



 Matthew 5:1-12 LEB 1 Now when he saw the crowds, he went up the mountain and after he sat down, his disciples approached him. 2 And opening his mouth he began to teach them, saying, 

3 â€œ**Blessed _1_** are the poor in spirit,  ~~because 1~~ theirs is the kingdom of heaven. 

4 **Blessed _2_** are the ones who mourn,  ~~because 2~~ they will be comforted. 

5 **Blessed _3_** are the meek,  ~~because 3~~ they will inherit the earth. 

6 **Blessed _4_** are the ones who hunger and thirst for righteousness,  ~~because 4~~ they will be satisfied. 

7 **Blessed _5_** are the merciful,  ~~because 5~~ they will be shown mercy. 

8 **Blessed _6_** are the pure in heart,  ~~because 6~~ they will see God. 

9 **Blessed _7_** are the peacemakers,  ~~because 7~~ they will be called sons of God. 

10 **Blessed _8_** are those who are persecuted because of righteousness,  ~~because 8~~ theirs is the kingdom of heaven. 

11 **Blessed _9_** are you  when they insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things against you, lying on account of me. 12 Rejoice and be glad, ~~because 9~~ your reward is great in heaven, for in the same way they persecuted the prophets before you.

Yeshua is ashrei #1. BLESSED IS THE I AM. 

So there are 10 words.

> Yeshua is ashrei #1. BLESSED IS THE I AM. 
> 
> So there are 10 words. 

I've been pondering something similarly. I know that Yeshua is casting himself as the word, and the word is actually the one who gave the 10 words in the synagogue targhums. So I wondered if he is the missing word. But I have also wondered, is there a missing word? 

Rather than the solution being Yeshua himself is the 10th word, although this may in fact be the way to go if I can find a legitimate route to prove it in his argumentation and the scope of his sayings, what if it's something else? 

Kind of on the nose but what if the word that is missing is Shabbat?


This would be circa the woman searching for her 10th coin because she has nine, and she rejoices because she finds it. But in another scheme maybe the happiness that comes from the unspoken 10 word is the reception of Yeshua himself. ğŸ¤·.

If it is true we will be able to find it. There are too many references to the 10 words to deny. Why would the number go from 10 to 9?.

body:
First, you FORGIVE them!  As an aside, Even if they hate me and keep sinning & never confess their sins, I still forgive them. I was trained by my rabbi, the Messiah to order all my prayers with these words : forgive me of my sins ONLY as I forgive those who sin against me.

But what then? What do you do after forgiving them?what do you do next?

You should help them to choose to repent.

A note on the word repent is helpful. The english word repent didn't exist in Yeshua's day, because English didn't exist. (Got 'em :P) The word actually means RETURN. Our Teacher Yeshua went from village to village yelling RETURN, the Kingdom of heaven is here.

return to God, go back to his house, go back to his people. here it is helpful to use a synonym of return, rejoin (also not in existence :P). Rejoin God, rejoin his people. 

This is a call to choose, and a call to choose participation. 



## unformed thoughts
- Turning the other cheek DOES NOT mean 
- he has opened up and confessed how be harmed, but he has done NOTHING to heal ; he has broken, but done nothing to fixit. he hasn't rebuilt what he broke, or rejoined in the building process.
- have nothing to do with darkness but rather even expose it....

body:
# creation is a low Act beneath God requiring an emptying / Kenosis which is itself an embodiment

Creating is beneath GOD. it is an an act that itself requires stooping, deigning, kenosis to perform it.

IN RELATION TO GOD,
all creation ( any part of it examined, or all of it extant) is  a _finite lesser bounded/[read_embodied_] object_


creating (any one thing ever or all things ever) requires touching/ interfacing with lesser/definite/bounded object.

To create required an emptying = the act of creating (a finite lesser object) requires GOD to stoop to interface and bring into being


creation, both the heavens and the earth are called God's garments, God's clothing

This begs a question? Does God have a "body" to put the clothing on? 

I argue here that the very act of CREATING was an act of embodiment of sorts.



Thus GOD "embodied" himself to create. His creation is his clothing ( to Cover his nakedness) . This nakedness we can call his "glory". We can also call this naked embodiment his IMAGE, or said differently : the IMAGE OF GOD.

The Torah, Targums, and NT calls this embodiment The WORD.

body:
# why do Christians depict God's end game / final plan as an escape mission instead of an invasion?
- I heard someone say this is not my home. I will be called home when I die.

I understand the sentiment, especially because the current configuration of the age and World Order is not our home. it is the evil age, the world, scheme overseen by the god of the age, the exile. but that is an ontological state of creation.

the scriptures depict God returning and allowing Satan in the Coalition of gods to inherit nothing. everything they have will be stripped of them and they themselves will die like men. God promises an invasion followed by a reclamation.

consider a parable: imagine creation as a daughter of God. imagine this daughter is kidnapped, dressed as a prostitute, pimped out by an oppressor, and living the life of a prostitute. if God seeks to "escape" this situation he is not good. at the same time you can see that creation dressed as a prostitute, living a life of a prostitute is not our home either. God's solution to this is to return, invade, destroy and bring to ultimate ruination The Pimps and oppressors, destroy the prostitute garb of his daughter and give her the Robes of daughterhood.  this is what God will do to creation. this is his end game. we are called to long for this end game, perpetuate it's arrival, and participate in the invasion, the battling, the war, and the reclamation, and reconstitution of creation.

body:
# Are the 10 plagues and pharonic dialogues purposefully functioning as negative Omens Within the Egyptian religious paradigm?

Does the Torah depict the 10 plagues & back & forth between Pharaoh on the one hand & Moshe, Aaron (angels) / Yahweh on the other PARTLY as oracular imprecations (negative omens) related to eternality/death punishment within the cultural paradigm of contemporaneous Egyptian religion? Specifically about Ma'at weighing the heart of the deceased, including Pharaoh. Ma'at would weigh the heart of the deceased against the feather of Ma'at. If lighter or equal, tung enter into joyful afterlife. If the heart is heavy, they are devoured by Ammit. Trying to avoid being devoured by Ammit would be an incredible irony if you consider the following Pharonic command :

Exodus 1:22 LEB And Pharaoh commanded all his people, saying, â€œEvery son who is born you will throw into the Nile, and every daughter you will let live.â€

Ammit is a demon, lesser deity that is only feared: she is a chimera with a crocodile head, lion parts, and a hippo hindquarter : all apex predators associated with the Nile. If your heart is heavy, i.e. evil, Ammit will be dispatched to devour the heart, thus condemning that person to Duat, annihilating them and preventing entry to the after life.

- circa Walton's sun & moon omen explanation for Yehoshua & the sun standing still?

## ancient sources

"42 Negative Confessions (Papyrus of Ani)
edit
The negative confessions one would make after death could be individualized, that is, vary from person to person. These were the confessions found in the Papyrus of Ani:[62]

Hail, Usekh-nemmt, who comest forth from Anu, I have not committed sin.
Hail, Hept-khet, who comest forth from Kher-aha, I have not committed robbery with violence.
Hail, Fenti, who comest forth from Khemenu, I have not stolen.
Hail, Am-khaibit, who comest forth from Qernet, I have not slain men and women.
Hail, Neha-her, who comest forth from Rasta, I have not stolen grain.
Hail, Ruruti, who comest forth from Heaven, I have not purloined offerings.
Hail, Arfi-em-khet, who comest forth from Suat, I have not stolen the property of God.
Hail, Neba, who comest and goest, I have not uttered lies.
Hail, Set-qesu, who comest forth from Hensu, I have not carried away food.
Hail, Utu-nesert, who comest forth from Het-ka-Ptah, I have not uttered curses.
Hail, Qerrti, who comest forth from Amentet, I have not committed adultery.
Hail, Hraf-haf, who comest forth from thy cavern, I have made none to weep.
Hail, Basti, who comest forth from Bast, I have not eaten the heart.
Hail, Ta-retiu, who comest forth from the night, I have not attacked any man.
Hail, Unem-snef, who comest forth from the execution chamber, I am not a man of deceit.
Hail, Unem-besek, who comest forth from Mabit, I have not stolen cultivated land.
Hail, Neb-Maat, who comest forth from Maati, I have not been an eavesdropper.
Hail, Tenemiu, who comest forth from Bast, I have not slandered anyone.
Hail, Sertiu, who comest forth from Anu, I have not been angry without just cause.
Hail, Tutu, who comest forth from Ati, I have not debauched the wife of any man.
Hail, Uamenti, who comest forth from the Khebt chamber, I have not debauched the wives of other men.
Hail, Maa-antuf, who comest forth from Per-Menu, I have not polluted myself.
Hail, Her-uru, who comest forth from Nehatu, I have terrorized none.
Hail, Khemiu, who comest forth from Kaui, I have not transgressed the law.
Hail, Shet-kheru, who comest forth from Urit, I have not been angry.
Hail, Nekhenu, who comest forth from Heqat, I have not shut my ears to the words of truth.
Hail, Kenemti, who comest forth from Kenmet, I have not blasphemed.
Hail, An-hetep-f, who comest forth from Sau, I am not a man of violence.
Hail, Sera-kheru, who comest forth from Unaset, I have not been a stirrer up of strife.
Hail, Neb-heru, who comest forth from Netchfet, I have not acted with undue haste.
Hail, Sekhriu, who comest forth from Uten, I have not pried into other's matters.
Hail, Neb-abui, who comest forth from Sauti, I have not multiplied my words in speaking.
Hail, Nefer-Tem, who comest forth from Het-ka-Ptah, I have wronged none, I have done no evil.
Hail, Tem-Sepu, who comest forth from Tetu, I have not worked witchcraft against the king.
Hail, Ari-em-ab-f, who comest forth from Tebu, I have never stopped the flow of water of a neighbor.
Hail, Ahi, who comest forth from Nu, I have never raised my voice.
Hail, Uatch-rekhit, who comest forth from Sau, I have not cursed God.
Hail, Neheb-ka, who comest forth from thy cavern, I have not acted with arrogance.
Hail, Neheb-nefert, who comest forth from thy cavern, I have not stolen the bread of the gods.
Hail, Tcheser-tep, who comest forth from the shrine, I have not carried away the khenfu cakes from the spirits of the dead.
Hail, An-af, who comest forth from Maati, I have not snatched away the bread of the child, nor treated with contempt the god of my city.
Hail, Hetch-abhu, who comest forth from Ta-she, I have not slain the cattle belonging to the god."

body:
Consider the societal normalization of certain conditions and arrangements that are in fact novel. Consider a line of socratic questioning 

Can humans devise arrangements and setups that are harmful for humans? 
If the answer is yes can these harmful arrangements become the generationally normalized? Was human sacrifice normalized in chiapas and other coastal Mexican planes areas and medieval periods? 
Once normalized, can these societal arrangements being perceived as negative become a more difficult achievement from the perspective of the one arranged in calling it normal? Is it a difficult task because it creates cognitive dissonance in the one who is entrenched and trying to determine if their own normal is in fact harmful?
title: Understanding sociological normalization over generations

body:
# Courtship Marriage Questions
## S1 Earth 
### S101 WATER 
- [ ] How do you want to source water? Do you want it well? Do you want to use city water? Filtration? 
- [ ] How do you envision preparing food? Each of you taking turns? Both of you cooking together? Will kids be involved?
- [ ]  Do you see this as a woman's duty?
- [ ] Who is primarily going to do grocery shopping? How do you want to source your food? How important is this to you?
- [ ] What are your plans for diet and nutritional needs?
- [ ] Do you want to grow your own food? 
- [ ] Think of two poles: one pole is frugality and saving money, the other pole is preferred food goals. Which bowl is more important to you and why? 
- [ ] To what degree do you want to be off-grid in regards to food and water? This is like asking how much reliance are you comfortable with in relying on governmental and city structures and services for water and food?
- [ ] How frequently do you want to eat and drink? How many meals? Snacks?
- [ ]  What about meal routines for children? 
- [ ] What kind of portions do you eat at various meals? 
- [ ] Do you want to eat sit down meals at every meal? Only one meal? Only two? 
- [ ] What kind of budget do you want to allot for water and food?
### S102 CLOTHING
- [ ] Do you want your wife to wear a head covering?
- [ ] How important is clothing and fashion to you? 
- [ ] Are you comfortable wearing hand-me-down or thrift clothing?
- [ ] What kind of budget do you want to allot for clothing? 
### S103 TENT HOUSING

- [ ] What kind of housing is completely off limits and unsuitable to you?
- [ ] How important is the aesthetics and the aesthetical appearance of your house?

### S104 LAND
### S105 PRODUCE & INCOME
### S106 TOOLS
### S107 STORED WEALTH
### S201 LOST / COMMUNITY
### S202 KIN W/DUTY | RELATIVES
- [ ] In what way do you want your spouse to honor your mother? Your father? What kind of actions and behaviors do you hope to see your spouse perform towards your parents?
- [ ] How frequently do you hope to see your parents?
- [ ]  How frequently do you want your spouse to see your parents? Do you plan on trying to maintain hanging out with your parents separate from your spouse?
- [ ] What kind of duties do you want your parents perform for your marriage?
- [ ] What kind of duties do you anticipate or foresee your parents performing for your house of name? What kind of activities do you see them doing together? Doing with Their grandchildren and your children?
- [ ] What is the meaningful time spent interfacing with relatives look like to you?

### S203 Those being called/ Temple / onboarding & intersections
### S204 SYNAGOGUE / Household of Households
### S205 HOUSEHOLD
### S206 HOUSE OF NAME
### S207 MARRIAGE
- [ ] What is your definition of sex?
- [ ] How frequently do you think you and your spouse should have sex?
- [ ] What does a healthy sex life look like?
- [ ] Describe the role and importance of physical affection and physical contact being shown to your spouse.

## S3 MEMBERS
- [ ] How important is exercise to you?
- [ ]  How frequently do you exercise? 
- [ ] Do you plan on exercising together? Do you want it to be a family activity or do you prefer to exercise alone? 
## S4 GUT
- [ ] How important is play in your life?
- [ ] What kind of games do you play?
- [ ] Will you play games as a family? What sort of games?
- [ ] Describe the inclusion of screens in your life. 
- [ ] How often do you want you and your spouse to interface with screens? How often do you want your house of name to interface with screens? How often do you want your children to interface with screens?
- [ ] How frequently do you plan to play with your children?
- [ ] How important is Beauty in your life?
- [ ] Describe how you plan to put beautiful things, beautiful stories, and beauty in front of your own eyes regularly
- [ ] Describe how you plan to put beautiful things and beauty in front of the eyes of your spouse and your children regularly.

#  The breastplate and the course of lights as time


## zodiac
"The zodiac forms a celestial coordinate system, or more specifically an ecliptic coordinate system, which takes the ecliptic as the origin of latitude and the Sun's position at vernal equinox as the origin of longitude.[4] In modern astronomy, the ecliptic coordinate system is still used for tracking Solar System objects."

- John 7 and John 8 constantly depict Yeshua where he comes from and where he goes his hour had not yet come he is the light

- the Sun rising out of the East and setting in the water is connected to baptism. Immersion in water the beginning of the day, and rising anew. Baptism is the start of the day.

body:
# simple or not?

One cultures definition of simple concepts or simple presentations of information may not translate as "simple" to another cultures conception of simple due to possessing different semantic backgrounds.

What is simple to a first century second temple Jew maybe bizarrely obtuse, incongruent, disconnected to a simple reader located in postmodern digital times.
title: One cultures definition of simple concepts or simple presentations of information may not translate as "simple" to another cultures conception of simple due to possessing different semantic backgrounds

Deu 6:4-5 YLT 'Hear, O Israel, Jehovah our God is one Jehovah; and thou hast loved Jehovah thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might,

Psa 27:4 LEB One thing I have asked from Yahweh; it I will seek: that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of Yahweh, and to consider his temple.

Psa 119:136 LEB Streams of water flow down from my eyes, because people do not heed your law.

Psa 119:20 LEB My soul is crushed with longing for your ordinances at all times.

Isa 26:9 LEB I desire you with all my soul in the night; also I seek you with my spirit within me, for when your judgments are upon the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

Phi 3:7-11 LEB But whatever things were gain to me, these things I have considered loss because of Christ. More than that, I even consider all things to be loss because of the surpassing greatness of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for the sake of whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and consider them dung, in order that I may gain Christ and may be found in him, not having my righteousness which is from the law, but which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness from God on the basis of faith, so that I may know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings, being conformed to his death, if somehow I may attain to the resurrection from the dead.

And whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me. The one who finds his life will lose it, and the one who loses his life because of me will find it.

1Co 8:5-6 LEB For even if after all there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth, just as there are many gods and many lords, yet to us there is one God, the Father, from whom are all things, and we are for him, and there is one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we are through him.

1Co 8:2-6 LEB If anyone thinks he knows anything, he has not yet known as it is necessary to know. But if anyone loves God, this one is known by him. Therefore, concerning the eating of food sacrificed to idols, we know that "an idol is nothing in the world" and that "there is no God except one." Psa 28:1-2 LEB A psalm of David. To you, O Yahweh, I call. O my rock, do not be deaf to me. Or else, if you are silent to me, then I will become like those descending to the pit. Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy inner sanctuary.

My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you as in a dry and weary land without water. Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary, beholding your strength and glory. Because your loyal love is better than life, my lips will praise you.

Psa 63:3 LEB Because your loyal love is better than life, my lips will praise you.

Psa 101:1-2 LEB Of David. A psalm. I will sing of loyal love and justice; I will sing praises to you, O Yahweh. I will give attention to the way of integrity. When will you come to me? I will walk in the integrity of my heart in the midst of my house.

Mat 3:16-17 LEB Now after he was baptized, Jesus immediately went up from the water, and behold, the heavens opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove coming upon him. And behold, there was a voice from heaven saying, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased."

Mat 4:1-4 LEB Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil, and after he had fasted forty days and forty nights, then he was hungry. And the tempter approached and said to him, "If you are the Son of God, order that these stones become bread." But he answered and said, "It is written, 'Man will not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes out of the mouth of God."

And you shall remember all of the way that Yahweh your God led you during these forty years in the desert in order to humble you and to test you to know what is in your heart, whether you would diligently keep his commandments or not. Eph 5:18-20 LEB And do not be drunk with wine (in which is dissipation), but be filled by the Spirit, speaking to one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and singing praise in your heart to the Lord, giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to the God and Father,

Jos 1:6-9 LEB Be strong and courageous, for you will give the people this land as an inheritance that I swore to their ancestors to give them. Only be strong and very courageous to observe diligently the whole law that Moses my servant commanded you. Do not turn aside from it, to the right or left, so that you may succeed wherever you go. The scroll of this law will not depart from your mouth; you will meditate on it day and night so that you may observe diligently all that is written in it. Do we really have the power to become all things to all people and save some of them? 

Can we really save people who without our choice to save them will die 

By suicide? 
Inwardly by self-loathing and rejection?
By alcoholism? 
By drug overdoses? 
By violence? 
By being walled in by emptiness and screens?
By enslavement and captivity of the enemy?

body:
# Is John chapter 1 , the prologue, describing the light and the light of the world as the chief shiner that directs mankind toward God's special meeting times? Is the apostle John depicting the word as the chief Shabbat director causing man and God to meet? Is this on purpose as a cosmological meeting time and meeting director and joiner? 

This could explain why John places this designation of yeshua as the light at the beginning of his gospel and in his prologue in particular. This could explain the initial demonstration of the ordered rationale of the structure of the whole gospel being sacred sabbaths and sacred meeting times honing in on Jerusalem and the temple.

I have known for a long time that John's structure is calendrical or based on the sacred Sabbath calendar. I have known that John depicts yeshua's movements according to the sacred calendar and high holy days and sabbaths in connection to the Jerusalem Temple. What is new is that John may be using the title of Jesus the light as the director of the sacred times because John may be wanting us to see titling Jesus as the light as titling Jesus as the one who directs the meeting times the light in Genesis 1:14. This is why in Genesis 1 it describes the first thing being structured as the light but when the light which is structured is enumerated in verse 14 it shows that it's purpose is for the meeting times. John begins his gospel with a relaying and a retelling and reordering of Genesis 1 centered on yeshua. This could be explaining why he does that out of all the titles that yeshua may hold, John is specifically showing yeshua as the light the one who directs the meeting times vis-a-vis the meetings between man and God.

## prologue passages

Joh 1:4-5 YLT 4 In him was life, and the life was the light of men, 5 and the light in the darkness did shine, and the darkness did not perceive it.

Joh 1:7-9 YLT 7 this one came for testimony, that he might testify about the Light, that all might believe through him; 8 that one was not the Light, but--that he might testify about the Light. 9 He was the true Light, which doth enlighten every man, coming to the world;

## More John thinking on the subject from John writings 

Joh 12:35-36 YLT 35 Jesus, therefore, said to them, 'Yet a little time is the light with you; walk while ye have the light, that darkness may not overtake you; and he who is walking in the darkness hath not known where he goeth; 36 while ye have the light, believe in the light, that sons of light ye may become.' These things spake Jesus, and having gone away, he was hid from them,
1Jn 1:5 LEB And this is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light and there is no darkness in him at all.
1Jn 1:7 LEB But if we walk in the light as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

## questions
- [ ] does John have a more Torah Moses centered reason for employing the title The light, and applying that title to Yeshua as the messiah in particular, the promised Moses successor? 
- [ ] if so does John have a more Torah Moses centered reason for employing the title the word, and applying that title to Yeshua as the Messiah in particular, the promised Moses successor? Is this more is this more Torah centered reason for employing the title The word, actually the Torah, the law itself? Should we be thinking of the word as a slant or near synonym or an echo of the law of Moses, the Torah of God itself?

comments.body: @TonyLinog you need to read this! @leighlinog shared with me some insights she got reading about the gospel of John and it's calendrical connection, to the title the light in particular. John calls Jesus the light. It dawned on me, pun intended, that maybe there is a rationale in John depicting him as the light.

## practices
- chanting / songs for vigil: 
     - inwardly repeat and lovingly say these  chants and chant parts in a row to Yeshua, the glory. Kind of sing them as a song of love to Yeshua within you, the Spirit of Messiah that lives within you:
     - **the word, flesh, blood chant**:
          - THE WORD MADE ALL FLESH. THE FLESH HOLDS THE BLOOD. THE BLOOD HOLDS THE LIFE.
          - THE WORD BECAME FLESH.
          - THE FLESH OF THE WORD HOLDS THE BLOOD OF THE WORD. THE BLOOD OF THE WORD HOLDS THE LIFE OF THE WORD.
     - **the OUR food and drink and life chant**:
          - we love you Yeshua, you are our bread. We love you Yeshua, you are our wine. We love you Yeshua, you are our life
          - we love you Yeshua, you are our flesh. We love you,  Yeshua you are our blood. We love you Yeshua, you are our Spirit.
          - we love you Yeshua, you our flesh that gives us our bread. We love you Yeshua, you are our blood that gives us our wine. We love you Yeshua, you are our Spirit, that gives us our life.

## WHERE (places)
###  gathering circle
### overflow

## SUPPORTING PASSAGES 

- Deuteronomy 31:12-13 LEB 12 Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little children and your aliens that are in your towns, so that they may hear and so that they may learn and they may revere Yahweh your God, and they shall diligently observe all the words of this law. 13 And then their children, who have not known, they too may hear, and they may learn to revere Yahweh their God all the days that you live on the land that you are crossing the Jordan to get there to take possession of it.â€
- Isaiah 6:1-4 LEB 1 In the year of the death of Uzziah the king, I saw the Lord sitting on a high and raised throne, and the hem of his robe was filling the temple. 2 Seraphs were standing above him. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew. 3 And the one called to the other and said,  â€œHoly, holy, holy is Yahweh of **hosts** ARMIES!  The whole earth is full of his glory.â€ 4 And the pivots of the thresholds shook from the sound of those who called, and the house was filled with smoke.
- 1 Corinthians 14:40 LEB But let all things be done decently and according to proper procedure.
- Numbers 1:18-20 LEB 18 and they summoned the entire community on the first day of the second month. And they registered themselves among their clans according to their families, according to the number of names from those twenty years old and above individually, 19 just as Yahweh commanded Moses. And he counted them in the desert of Sinai. 20 The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, every male individually from twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
- 1 Corinthians 11:10 LEB Because of this, the woman ought to have a symbol of authority on her head, on account of the angels.
     - scope of inclusion: inclusion of insiders & outsiders / inclusion of genders male and female / inclusion of ages down to small children (×˜×£ )  [who can walk and be instructed {as witnesses} and learners of the Torah ]
- create a gathering order (and environment) that facilitates, causes/executes/performs [auditorially] hearing [ obeying ] the Torah [ that is read out loud]
- create a gathering order (and environment) that facilitates, causes/executes/performs KNOWING [ intimately joining oneself] to [ the written and heard ] Torah [being read and explained]
- 

### judgements / directives 
- [ ] the point of the contribution circle for contributing participants is maintaining a vigil of love and causing that love to manifest and build up the body that is presently circled 
- [ ] the only contributing participant that isn't maintaining a vigil of Love at a given point, and this still could be aimed for, is the contributing participant who is training a witness participant. 
- [ ] if you are not keeping the vigil there is no point in you being a part of the contributing circle.
- [ ] no one should be made to come to the conclusion or to feel that they have to BOTH perform their duty as a contributing participant keeping vigil AND nursing and caring for non-witnesses because of Shadow/reflection duty at the same time. 
- [ ] likewise, the inverse of this, no one should come to the conclusion or be made to feel that they are in fact performing BOTH of these duties. If you are tending to and nursing and caring for non-witnesses that you have reflection duty towards, you are not ministering to intending to the substance duty of keeping vigil and contributing as an agent of heaven. You can't do both. 
- [ ] this is not an attack on either. This will speak to the necessity of making the overflow play necessarily richly diverse space of exchange. Sharpening an arrow that is a non witness is an incredible joy and a holy endeavor. We need to make this the explicit aim of parents who have non-witnesses. We need to make it open to share these goals and AIMS in the burden of them with housemates and anyone else who willingly wants to share and participate. 
- [ ] the overflow space is not arranged at a group level. It is a space that is provided for individuals to move in and out of according to their own discretion and responsibility. 
- [ ] a child that is a non-witness and cannot be trained to be a witness need not be present in the build-up circle. They should not be quarantined, silenced, cajoled, restricted as they have no share or benefit that can result from this time. It is not fair to them.

# the practice

## components or elements of the practice
- [ ] engaging the mind: meshalim for mind engagement ( Hebrew word for proverb is the same word for parable. It is a governing or likeness or a likening)
     - [ ] a mashal of King Solomon son of David 
     - [ ] hey Mashal of King Yeshua son of David 
     - [ ] one of the 613 mitzvot in the rambam's list
     - [ ] a parable of our own or someone else's 
     - [ ] circa Aesop's fable 
     - [ ] use a MOVIE you've watched as a parable / likeness for enlightening / an instructing /talking about movies we have already seen as parables or vehicles for instructing
     - [ ] use a TV SHOW you've watched as a parable / likeness for enlightening / an instructing / talking about TV shows we have already seen as parables or vehicles for instruction
     - [ ] use a BOOK you've read as a parable / likeness for enlightening / an instructing
- [ ] when you are aiming at the mind with a parable try to aim and talk about the special job of each part of L6 or the special job of just one person in L6
- [ ] engaging the heart: words of affection, identity statements, saying I want to be deeply known by you, I want to deeply know you. I want to be known by you  MORE, I want to know you MORE. I didn't know you like I want to know you. I don't know you as deeply as I want to know. You don't know me as deeply as I want to be known by you. Embolden others to be tanks in embracing their gospel seed identity
- [ ] engaging the gut: satisfaction to entertainment / sport/merriment to beauty 
- [ ] engaging the members: eye contact/aimed at the other, ears stretched to the othertouching in affection, high fives, auditory: exclamation of excitement at the other yelling yes, awesome, Amen, you got it!

BEHOLD, I WILL STAND BEFORE THEE THERE UPON THE ROCK IN HOREB. Since the wonder with the water in this place was now to become a permanent feature as long as they would be in the wilderness, as our Rabbis have said, this was why the Divine Glory was revealed upon it at this place, just as it says concerning the manna, And in the morning, then ye shall see the Glory of the Eternal, since it remained a continuous wonder.

×”× × ×™ ×¢×•××“ ×œ×¤× ×™×š ×©× ×¢×œ ×”×¦×•×¨ ×‘×—×•×¨×‘, â€œhere I shall stand in front of you there by the Chorev (mountain).â€ This rock at Refidim was the same rock which we encounter almost 40 years later at Kadesh. This was also the source of the well of Miriam which traveled with the Israelites through the desert during all those years (compare Bamidbar Rabbah 1,2). The very word ×”× × ×™ used by Gâ€™d prior to the rock erupting in a well was the same as that used by Gâ€™d prior to releasing the manna from heaven. Just as the manna became a daily feature for the remainder of their trek through the desert until Mosesâ€™ death, so the well which appeared here for the first time became the Israelitesâ€™ constant companion at least until the death of Miriam. Furthermore, just as the giving of the manna had been preceded by a revelation of Gâ€™dâ€™s glory (16,7), so the miracle of the rock erupting as a well was also preceded by a revelation of the glory of Gâ€™d seeing it was an ongoing miracle just as was that of the manna (compare Nachmanides).

×”Ö¸×™Ö°×ªÖ¸×” ×•Ö°×Öµ×™×Ÿ ×”Ö¸×›Öµ×Ÿ ×Ö¶×œÖ¼Ö¸× ×œÖ·×©Ö¼×Ö·×‘Ö¼Ö¸×ª, ×©×Ö¶× Ö¼Ö¶×Ö±×Ö·×¨ (×©××•×ª ×˜×–, ×”): ×•Ö°×”Ö¸×™Ö¸×” ×‘Ö¼Ö·×™Ö¼×•Ö¹× ×”Ö·×©Ö¼×Ö´×©Ö¼×Ö´×™ ×•Ö°×”Öµ×›Ö´×™× ×•Ö¼ ×•×’×•'. ×Ö¸×Ö·×¨ ×”Ö·×§Ö¼Ö¸×“×•Ö¹×©× ×‘Ö¼Ö¸×¨×•Ö¼×šÖ° ×”×•Ö¼×, ×™×•Ö¹×¡Öµ×£ ×Ö·×ªÖ¼Ö¸×” ×©×Ö´×Ö¼Ö·×¨Ö°×ªÖ¼Ö¸ ×Ö¶×ª ×”Ö·×©Ö¼×Ö·×‘Ö¼Ö¸×ª ×¢Ö·×“ ×©×Ö¶×œÖ¹× × Ö´×ªÖ¼Ö°× Ö¸×” ×”Ö·×ªÖ¼×•Ö¹×¨Ö¸×”, ×—Ö·×™Ö¼Ö¶×™×šÖ¸ ×©×Ö¶×Ö²× Ö´×™ ×Ö°×©×Ö·×œÖ¼Öµ× ×œÖ°×‘Ö¶×Ÿ ×‘Ö¼Ö´× Ö°×šÖ¸ ×©×Ö¶×™Ö¼Ö°×”Öµ× ×Ö·×§Ö°×¨Ö´×™×‘ ×§Ö¸×¨Ö°×‘Ö¼Ö¸× ×•Ö¹ ×‘Ö¼Ö·×©Ö¼×Ö·×‘Ö¼Ö¸×ª, ×Ö·×” ×©Ö¼×Ö¶×Öµ×™×Ÿ ×™Ö¸×—Ö´×™×“ ×Ö·×§Ö°×¨Ö´×™×‘, ×•Ö°×¢Ö¸×œÖ·×™ ×œÖ°×§Ö·×‘Ö¼Öµ×œ ×§Ö¸×¨Ö°×‘Ö¼Ö¸× ×•Ö¹ ×‘Ö¼Ö°×¨Ö¸×¦×•Ö¹×Ÿ, ×”Ö±×•Öµ×™: ×Ö´×™ ×”Ö´×§Ö°×“Ö¼Ö´×™×Ö·× Ö´×™ ×•Ö·×Ö²×©×Ö·×œÖ¼Öµ×, ×•Ö¼×Ö´× Ö¼Ö·×™Ö´×Ÿ ×©×Ö¶×›Ö¼Öµ×Ÿ ×”×•Ö¼×, ×Ö´×Ö¼Ö·×” ×©Ö¼×Ö¶×Ö¸××•Ö¼×¨ ×‘Ö¼Ö¸×¢Ö´× Ö°×™Ö¸×Ÿ ×‘Ö¼Ö·×™Ö¼×•Ö¹× ×”Ö·×©Ö¼×Ö°×‘Ö´×™×¢Ö´×™ × Ö¸×©×‚Ö´×™× ×œÖ´×‘Ö°× Öµ×™ ×Ö¶×¤Ö°×¨Ö¸×™Ö´× ×•×’×•':
â€œOn the seventh dayâ€¦â€ â€“ that is what is written: â€œWho preceded Me? I will payâ€¦â€ (Job 41:3). Rabbi Taná¸¥um ben Rabbi Abba said: One who has no property but performs acts of charity and kindness; one who has no children but pays the wages of Bible teachers and Mishna teachers; one who does not have a house but prepares a mezuza , one who has no garment but prepares ritual fringes; one who has no sons but circumcises; one who prepares books and lends them to others, the Holy One blessed be He says: This one preceded and fulfilled My mitzvot before I provided him with the means to fulfill them; I must pay, give him money and children who will read these books. That is, â€œWho preceded Meâ€ â€“ to perform a mitzva; and I will pay his reward. Why? It is because I lack nothing, as the world and all its contents are Mine. That is why it is stated: â€œEverything beneath the heavens is Mineâ€ (Job 41:3). Another matter: â€œWho preceded Me? I will payâ€ (Job 41:3) â€“ it is speaking of Abraham, who recognized the Holy One blessed be He on his own, just as it is written: â€œA wayward [sug] heart will be sated from its waysâ€¦â€ (Proverbs 14:14).What is, â€œa wayward heart will be sated from its waysâ€? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: It is a heart that is filled with dross [sigim]; it is destined to be sated because of its ways. â€œBut a good man will be above himâ€ (Proverbs 14:14) â€“ this is Abraham, who recognized the Holy One blessed be He on his own. There was no person who taught him how to recognize the Holy One blessed be He; rather he did so on his own. This is one of four people who recognized the Holy One blessed be He on their own. Job recognized the Holy One blessed be He on his own; from where is it derived? It is as it says: â€œFrom my practice I treasured the sayings of His mouthâ€ (Job 23:12). Hezekiah king of Judah, too, recognized the Holy One blessed be He on his own; from where is it derived? It is as it is written in his regard: â€œHe will eat butter and honey, by his knowledge, spurning the bad and choosing the goodâ€ (Isaiah 7:15). The messianic king recognized the Holy One blessed be He on his own. Likewise, Abraham, the Holy One blessed be He said to him: â€˜The upper world and the world below are Mine,â€™ just as it says: â€œEverything beneath the heavens is Mineâ€ (Job 41:3), and it says: â€œThe earth and all its contents are the Lordâ€™sâ€ (Psalms 24:1). â€˜You caused My name to be known in the world; as you live, I will grant you the upper world and the world below, as it is stated: â€œHe blessed him, and he said: Blessed is Abram to God, the Most High, Master of heaven and earthâ€ (Genesis 14:19). That is, â€œwho preceded Me? I will pay.â€ Why? It is because â€œeverything beneath the heavens is Mine.â€ Another matter: â€œWho preceded Me? I will payâ€ (Job 41:3) â€“ Rabbi Elazar ben Rabbi á¸¤iyya said: Everything that Abraham performed for the ministering angels, the Holy One blessed be He repaid his descendants upon their exodus from Egypt, and He is destined to give them in the future. You find regarding Abraham: â€œPlease, let a little water be takenâ€ (Genesis 18:4). The Holy One blessed be He, too, repaid his descendants: â€œI will take you for Meâ€ (Exodus 6:7) â€“ corresponding to â€œPlease, let [a little water] be taken.â€ Rabbi Yoá¸¥anan said: I have derived only regarding this world, regarding the future, from where is it derived? â€œThe peoples will take them and bring them to their placeâ€ (Isaiah 14:2). Regarding Abraham it is written: â€œA little water,â€ and the Holy One blessed be He provided water for his descendants upon their exodus from Egypt: â€œYou shall strike the rock, and water will emerge from itâ€ (Exodus 17:6). Regarding the future, from where is it derived? â€œFor the Lord your God is bringing you to a good land, a land of streams of waterâ€¦â€ (Deuteronomy 8:7). Regarding the Messianic Era, from where is it derived? â€œThere will be pools and streams of water on every lofty mountain and on every high hillâ€ (Isaiah 30:25). Likewise, â€œI will open rivers on the bare hillsâ€ (Isaiah 41:18). Regarding Abraham it is written: â€œWash your feetâ€ (Genesis 18:4). The Holy One blessed be He granted it to his descendants upon their exodus from Egypt: â€œI washed you in waterâ€ (Ezekiel 16:9). And in the Land of Israel: â€œWash, purify yourselvesâ€ (Isaiah 1:16). Regarding the future, from where is it derived? â€œWhen the Lord will have washed [the excrement of the daughters of Zion]â€ (Isaiah 4:4). Regarding Abraham it is written: â€œAnd recline beneath the treeâ€ (Genesis 18:4), as he crafted a booth [sukka] for them. The Holy One blessed be He crafted booths for his descendants upon their exodus from Egypt: â€œThat I had the children of Israel dwell in booths [basukot], [when I took them out of the land of Egypt]â€ (Leviticus 23:43). In the Land of Israel: â€œYou shielded [sakota] my head on the day of battleâ€ (Psalms 140:8). What is â€œthe day of battle? It is the day of the arming of the thirty-one kings. Regarding the future, from where is it derived? â€œAnd a booth [sukka] will be for shade in the dayâ€¦â€ (Isaiah 4:6). That is, â€œwho preceded Me? I will payâ€¦â€(Job 41:3). Likewise it says: â€œCast your bread upon the water, for after many days [you will find it]â€ (Ecclesiastes 11:1). Another matter: â€œWho preceded Me? I will payâ€ (Job 41:3) â€“ it is speaking of Joseph, as he preceded and observed the Shabbat before it was given: â€œSlaughter an animal and prepare itâ€ (Genesis 43:16). Rabbi Yoá¸¥anan said: It was the day before Shabbat. â€œAnd prepareâ€ is nothing other than for Shabbat, as it is stated: â€œIt will be on the sixth day, they shall prepareâ€¦â€ (Exodus 16:5). The Holy One blessed be He said: Joseph, you observed the Shabbat before the Torah was given, as you live, your descendant will present his offering on Shabbat, when an individual does not present an offering. But it is incumbent upon Me to readily accept his offering. That is, â€œwho preceded Me? I will pay.â€ From where is it derived that this is so? It is from what is stated regarding this matter: â€œOn the seventh day, prince of the children of Ephraimâ€¦â€

body:
# There is a difference between the hiddenness of God and the accessibility of God
- the hiddenness of God has been struggled with since ancient times, is often a central theme of the temple prayer texts, the Psalms, and is an assumption that seems to be held by a considerable number of ancient Israelites themselves. 

- this is not a new problem. To imagine ancient people as backwards and superstitious to the point of unquestioned belief is anachronistic, wrong headed, and intellectually narcissistic. 

- aside from these things the real issue I want to address now is the difference between God's hiddenness on the one hand, and God's accessibility on the other hand. God is still locally directly accessible, even while he is in a cosmologically obfuscated arrangement. 

The steps or procedure for accessing God are executable in all times and all places, even in the exile. Because of some covenantal promises and the nature of those promises, the accident of certain elements in the procedure May themselves be inaccessible in cosmologically obfuscated orders and schemes.
title: There is a difference between the hiddenness of God and the accessibility of God

     - list a table of the reconstructed Palestinian triennial readings from the article The Reading of the Law and Prophets in a Triennial Cycle by rabbi Adolf BÃ¼chler. 
- is there any evidence that the Babylonian rabbis tried to keep intact the apportioning of the triennial sedarim when they innovated the annual parashot?
     - is it possible that the rabbis already had an annual reading cycle that they considered was more advanced and used for rabbis or disciples of rabbis? This is speculation, but it would map onto their concept of attaining more regular levels of piety via challenge

comments.body: What does this mean?

> What does this mean?

@TonyLinog I'll post more links in the comments below to pad my answer to your question: 

### SHORT ANSWER: 
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d05dd66-23d5-450f-b44d-8f5d5ba61e9f

Note on Galatians

"What is fascinating is how some classic â€œmagnetized readingsâ€ come up even in the New Testament. For instance, a traditional Haftarah for Genesis 16, the story of Sarah and Hagar, is Isaiah 54:1-10, Godâ€™s eschatological promise of bring joy to the childless:

â€œSing, barren woman,
you who never bore a child;
burst into song, shout for joy,
you who were never in labor;
because more are the children of the desolate woman
than of her who has a husband,â€
says the Lord. Isaiah 54:1

In Galatians 4, we find Paul using Sarah and Hagarâ€™s story in his discussion, and then pulling in Isaiah 54 at the end. It is thought that he did this because these passages were already linked in peopleâ€™s minds, having been read together regularly in the synagogue."
https://ourrabbijesus.com/articles/triennial-reading/#:~:text=into%20reading%20lists.-,What,-is%20fascinating%20is

Another super cool article 

https://torahresource.com/article/public-reading-of-the-scriptures-in-the-1st-century-synagogue/

# super cool article about how the rabbis changed the prophet readings because of Jesus and the new testament

https://www.oneforisrael.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Jesus-and-the-Haftarah.pdf
https://www.sefaria.org/Megillah.29b.20?lang=bi&with=all

## super cool historical note on the sedarim marks inside the Torah numbering 154!


The Masoretic divisions known as "sedarim" and variously indicated in the text, number 154 in the Pentateuch, and probably correspond, therefore, to the Sabbath lessons of the triennial system, as was first surmised by Rapoport ("Halikot á¸²edem," p. 11).

## trying to map out the math of how many shabbats can occur
The number varies, however, so that Menahem Me'iri reckoned 161 divisions, corresponding to the greatest number of Sabbaths possible in three years; the Yemen grammars and scrolls of the Pentateuch enumerate 167 (see Sidra); and the tractate Soferim (xvi. 10) gives the number as 175 (comp. Yer. Shab. i. 1).

## a. Buchler restoring order of sedarim 

A. BÃ¼chler has restored the order of the sedarim on the assumption that the reading of the Law was commenced on the 1st of Nisan and continued for three years, and he has found that Genesis would be begun on the 1st of Nisan, Deuteronomy on the 1st of Elul, Leviticus on the 1st of Tishri, and Exodus and Numbers on the 15th of Shebaá¹­, the four NewYears given in the Mishnah (R. H. i. 1). Nisan has always been regarded as the ecclesiastical NewYear. This arrangement would account for many traditions giving definite dates to Pentateuchal occurrences, the dates being, strictly speaking, those of the Sabbaths on which the lessons recording the occurrences are read. Thus, it is declared that the exodus from Egypt took place on Thursday, the 15th of Nisan ("Seder 'Olam," x.), and the passage relating to the Exodus was read on that day. The slaying of the Passover lamb is said to have occurred on the 10th of Nisan, and is described in Ex. xii. 21, the passage read in the triennial cycle on the second Sabbath of Nisan, which would be the 10th where the 15th fell on Thursday. This likewise explains the tradition that the Israelites encamped at Rameses on a Sabbath, the 17th of Nisan, on which Ex. xii. 37 would be read in the triennial cycle. The tradition that Rachel was remembered on New-Year's Day (R. H. 10b) is due to the fact that in the first year of the cycle the sidra Gen. xxx. 22, beginning, "And God remembered Rachel," would be read on Rosh ha-Shanah. As the reading of Deut. xxxiv. would occur on the 7th of Adar, there would be four remaining Sabbaths to be filled in before the new triennial cycle, which began with Nisan. Four special Sabbaths, Sheá¸³alim, Zakor, Parah, and Ha-á¸¤odesh, still occur in Adar. Including these and the festival parashiyyot, and possibly also the special sedarim for á¸¤anukkah and Purim, eleven extra divisions would be obtained, making up the 166 or 167 of the Yemen Bible.

body:
- Do we know our children's souls?
- Do we know our children's hearts? 
- Have we reached our fill of knowing our children's souls? 
- Have we reached our fill of knowing our children hearts?
- does it satisfy us to know our children's hearts? 
- does it satisfy us to know our children's souls? 
- can we teach the shema to our children if we don't know their soul? Can we teach them to love God with their soul if we don't know their soul? 
- can we teach the shema to our children if we don't know their heart? Can we teach them to love God with their heart if we don't know their heart?
- how do we get past the present moment and whatever circumstances it has to find and gain access to our child's soul?
- how do we get past the present moment and whatever circumstances of the present moment to find and gain access to our child's heart? 
- what is inside our child's heart? 
-  What is innately in our child's heart in terms of capacity and depth?
- sometimes when we look in our child's heart we may find that there is not much seemingly accessible, because in some ways our child's heart is like a garden bed, and it can be empty if we do not seed their heart regularly and water it and grow it. Sometimes we can be terrified to see the tumbleweed and emptiness of our child's heart.
- is it a wasted life to focus on knowing a child's heart? 
- is it a wasted life to become a master, and encyclopedia and cartographer of our child's soul? Is it a waste of time? 
- can we teach the shema to our child if we don't love our child in the teaching? Can we teach them to love God and the ACT of not - loving them as we teach?
- how dull is the heart of our child when it is unsharpened to love God? 
- who is supposed to be the cartographer to chart and map the soul of our child? 
- who is supposed to be the cartographer to chart and map the heart of our child?
- why are we not afraid of not knowing our child's heart? 
- why are we not afraid of knowing our child's soul? 
- why is it so easy to pass over trying to know further the soul of our child? 
- why is it so easy to pass over trying to know further the heart of our child?
- Why is conversation and speech the vehicle for finding the heart and soul of our child? 
- how do we position ourselves to set our eyes and to set our ears on our child and to watch closely and to watch deeply in the hopes of getting a sighting of their soul? 
- how do we position ourselves to set our eyes and to set our ears on our child and to watch closely and to watch deeply in the hopes of getting a sighting of their heart?
- can a child receive anything more important from a parent than to have their heart and soul known and loved by their parent?
- can I teach my child to love God while when I'm looking at them, I'm not interested in them and I'm not loving them?
- how long should I watch my child without saying anything? 
- how common should it be for me to watch my child, attentively, just trying to know them through their movements? 
- if I knew today was the last time that I could speak to my child, what would I say? 
- if I succeed in finding my child's heart and if I succeed in finding my child's soul, will I even know what to do with it?

title: Do we know our children's souls? Do we know our children's hearts? Have we reached our fill of knowing our children's souls? Have we reached our fill of knowing our children hearts?

body:
# overview 
## questions 
- does the rest envisioned in Shabbat constitute a summons away from making requests, and a call towards giving thanks for what we've already received or accomplished? 
- is it wrong try to use Shabbat to dream of Eden and imagine the perfect world? 
- is it wrong to make requests on Shabbat? 
- would it be wrong to try to dream of Eden in the week to come, on Shabbat? 
- is Shabbat aimed at the past, present, or future? Or bits of all three?
## concepts 
- I believe the perfect world and Shabbat are connected concepts. I believe Shabbat should be the manifestation of edenic perfection, the manifestation of Eden restored. The opposite of the House of slavery. Almost a break from the seen world imperfections to experience heaven's perfection.

title: Imagining and reimagining the perfect Shabbat

body:
The historically witnessed human,  Jesus of Nazareth, is the Jesus who will judge you.

Every attempt to undo the incarnation will fail. Every person who seeks to wrest Jesus from Nazareth and rest him in role they have formed and shaped will fail. 

THE WORD BECAME historically witnessed, Galilean accented, Y chromosomed, sleeping in a boat, covered and smothered by a crowd of Jews trying to touch his body. 

This entourage of Jews still surrounds the Jesus that will judge you. He put them there. It was his plan as far back as Isaiah. He appointed them to be witnesses of the days of his flesh. with their own thoughts and pasts they reflected, recollected, and shared their testimony. Of this testimony from the crowd of Jews surrounding Jesus, a sliver was written down. 

That's all we have for the witnessed Jesus.

That's all we have to access the Jesus of History. 

The spirit of Jesus that will testify about himself to all who call in his name, 

WILL NEVER TAKE THE JOB AWAY FROM THESE JEWISH WITNESSES.

The Spirit of Jesus is Jesus. The Jesus who saw the young son of Zebedee, John, called him to be a witness of himself to the world. 

Jesus will never silence the testimony of his witnesses. 

The Spirit of Jesus will do miraculous manifestations of power and signs: HE WILL NEVER SPEAK OR ACT TO REPLACE THE TESTIMONY OF HIS WITNESSES, THE SCRIPTURES, THEIR WRITINGS ABOUT HIM. 

Jesus of Nazareth appointed his own human witnesses of the days of his flesh. But what human witnesses were appointed for the days BEFORE his flesh?

The historical, Jesus of Nazareth, in his 30s, said all the Scriptures written witness to him. They are witnesses of Yeshua.

John 5:39-40 LEB 39 You search the scriptures because you think that you have eternal life in them, and it is these that testify about me. 40 And you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.

No encounter with the Spirit of Jesus will ever replace, nullify, or take the job of appointed witnesses testifying to Jesus.

We all must walk as that one walked. 

The Spirit will show us how to walk like Jesus. 

The Spirit of Jesus will NEVER replace the job of witnesses who witnessed Jesus of Nazareth walking on the Earth.


Both are REQUIRED to build his kingdom.


The Spirit of Jesus will show you how to do the commands of Jesus of Nazareth. 

The Spirit of Jesus will never replace the witness writings of these commands stored in Scripture by his witnesses. The Spirit will NEVER tell you the commands John and Peter witnessed separate from John and Peter's own testimony, so as to replace what they witnessed.

Note on Galatians 

"What is fascinating is how some classic â€œmagnetized readingsâ€ come up even in the New Testament.  For instance, a traditional Haftarah for Genesis 16, the story of Sarah and Hagar, is Isaiah 54:1-10, Godâ€™s eschatological promise of bring joy to the childless:

â€œSing, barren woman,
you who never bore a child;
burst into song, shout for joy,
you who were never in labor;
because more are the children of the desolate woman
than of her who has a husband,â€
says the Lord. Isaiah 54:1

In Galatians 4, we find Paul using Sarah and Hagarâ€™s story in his discussion, and then pulling in Isaiah 54 at the end. It is thought that he did this because these passages were already linked in peopleâ€™s minds, having been read together regularly in the synagogue."
 https://ourrabbijesus.com/articles/triennial-reading/#:~:text=into%20reading%20lists.-,What,-is%20fascinating%20is

body:
# key objectives
- we want to keep foundational moves connected to vowels in English alphabet
- there are a couple of combo moves in the yellow belt section that we should attach to a letter
- consider trying to keep the elbows somewhat grouped together
- consider trying to keep punches somewhat grouped together

## background
This is an attempt to map all of the foundational yellow belt krav Maga movements and routines to the English alphabet and to the Hebrew alphabet. 

This endeavor affords adults and older children who can spell to do fight routine movements by spelling out words with letter combinations in Hebrew or in english. 

You can do this with individual words, or you can string together entire verses and practice memorizing them in English or in Hebrew (I have been doing the 10 words in Hebrew and choppy bits while play fighting)

![IMG-20250630-WA0003.jpeg](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95a856d0-eb44-493c-a83c-fa54d94c9f16)

https://joshualinog.github.io/self-defense-alphabet-meditation/

This is a tool for people who want to combine meditation with play with exercise. Or if you just want to exercise and learn the fundamentals of the Krav Maga self-defense system, you can use our slideshow for a workout routine! For 10 seconds which will give you enough time to perform the moves. Go ahead try it out!

The slideshow behavior needs to be tweaked a little bit. It's misbehaving. It's doing it in the desktop browser and it's doing it in the mobile browser. Let's change two things. First are we able to display the 10-second timer in a element that is absolutely placed in the right corner of the full screen behavior?

This additional feature should help illustrate the problem.

It seems like when you click on full screen and the slide is supposed to change after 10 Mississippi, the full screen mode then collapses back into the small mode rather than continuing in full screen. So here is the problem, I click full screen and I see the letter alef. After 10 second, it transitions to bet, but it loses the full screen mode.

its starting to work, but let's refine.
Let's make sure that no transitions are taking place until the slider is clicked and brought into full screen mode. It doesn't look like that's happening, but I just want to be sure that it doesn't happen. Transitions between slides should only be taking place after it enters in the full screen mode. Next there's a problem in terms of the data order. It is jumping from the first letter alef to the third letter gimel. It is jumping again and skipping the letter dalet and going to the letter hey. every other letter it seems. Why would this be happening?

Okay the transition issue has been solved in regards to full screen and jumping back to small spring. However the data order is still messed up. It appears you structured the Json object as an array of objects. It also appears that the object order in terms of array index is correct and in alphabetical order. However I wonder if there is not an inherent order in the browser consuming objects in an array? I'm not real sure. Is there a way to give each letter a property like order or rather to use the arrays index to ensure that the object we're getting is the right letter in the right order?

Thayer Definition:

1. clean, pure
   1. physically
      1. purified by fire
      2. in a similitude, like a vine cleansed by pruning and so fitted to bear fruit
   2. in a levitical sense
      1. clean, the use of which is not forbidden, imparts no uncleanness
   3. ethically
      1. free from corrupt desire, from sin and guilt
      2. free from every admixture of what is false, sincere genuine
      3. blameless, innocent
      4. unstained with the guilt of anything

Origin: of uncertain affinity

TDNT entry: 09:53,4

I show up to every single part of my wife, my people. I visit every single one. I come down to every single person, and push to guard my special marriage image, and all the images that keep coming out, even the smallest seed.

I, the head husband word bodyguard, I am always visiting, never stopping, on the ground, face to face. When one person, even just one little person with one little life, loves on me, I love back big. If this one little person loves me with their little life, and keeps my commandments, and loves to love me, I will love back too big for their one little life. I will make sure that, no sneaking works. No hiding from the word bodyguard, no getting away. They will not be able to make their own fake marriage image in my special wife. I will make sure when they try to twist and break my special marriage image on purpose, that the action they did doesn't go away from them. I will make sure that the bad action they did, stays with them and on them. It will come after them and catch up to them. It will follow them for their whole tiny lifetime, four generations. When they break my special image, I will make sure that this breaking they did, sticks to them, to their sons, and to their grandsons. No matter how hard they try to separate their yucky action from themselves, and pretend so they can keep it hidden. I will always push, and I will not be lazy and just do nothing. I will not miss anything, and nothing will be hidden. I will show up against this person who hates me face to face. They will not go scot-free, that's not how I, the head husband word bodyguard moves.

body:
# THE FOUR QUESTIONS 
## 1. What is a god / what is God?
a god is a heaven person.
## 2. What is a human? 
a human is a earth person.
## 3. What is heaven? 
Heaven is a plurality of groups of layered places.
## 4. What is earth?
Earth is a single group of layered places.
title: The " FOUR QUESTIONS " / a pedagogical tool

body:
# four questions
1. What is a god / what is God?
2. What is a human? 
3. What is heaven? 
4. What is earth?

## this Arrangement / formulation 
God now can only be known as a spirit.
title: Foundational answer to four questions to most easily teach the shema
CHILDREN'S BOOKS as scribal project

body:
Children's books aimed at making micro parables (bite size), short audio bedtime stories, making the 10 words, each word into a short children's book, teaching and reteaching tiny micro bite size foundational concepts to be read out loud with children /to children/by children with illustrations. The illustrations would be beautiful, iconic, repetitive. Being able to burn these illustrations into wood and furniture as well as iconography that reinforces and fulfills Deuteronomy 6 to memorialize. 

If I could do this as a way to produce income, I would be able to focus on breaking down foundation into simpler and simpler articulations, and I would be able to focus on my daughter Euphrates as the primary recipient of these things. The goal would be to break it down to make even a child the down syndrome wise for salvation to become a disciple.

body: Matthew 20:1-16 LEB 1 â€œFor the kingdom of heaven is like a manâ€”the master of the houseâ€”who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard. 2 And after coming to an agreement with the workers for a denarius per day, he sent them into his vineyard. 3 And going out about the third hour, he saw others standing idle in the marketplace. 4 And to those people he said, â€˜You also go into the vineyard, and I will give you whatever is right.â€™ 5 So they went. Going out again about the sixth and ninth hour he did the same thing. 6 And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing there and said to them, â€˜Why are you standing here the whole day unemployed?â€™ 7 They said to him, â€˜Because no one hired us.â€™ He said to them, â€˜You go also into the vineyard.â€™ 8 And when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, â€˜Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last up to the first.â€™ 9 And when the ones hired about the eleventh hour came, they received a denarius apiece. 10 And when the first came, they thought that they would receive more, and they also received a denarius apiece. 11 And when they received it, they began to complain against the master of the house, 12 saying, â€˜These last people worked one hour and you made them equal to us who have endured the burden of the day and the burning heat!â€™ 13 But he answered one of them and said, â€˜Friend, I am not doing you wrong. Did you not come to an agreement with me for a denarius? 14 Take what is yours and go! But I want to give to this last person the same as I gave to you also. 15 Is it not permitted for me to do whatever I want with what is mine? Or is your eye evil because I am generous?â€™ 16 Thus the last will be first and the first last.â€
title: Waves of workers in vineyard parable as an argument against dispensationalism, replacement theology

body:
# regimen overview 

So here's what I'm envisioning, I go to walk laps around the lot with the goal of accomplishing a set mileage. At my typical rate it takes about 2ish hours to make 50 laps which is 5 miles. In the course of that 2 hours I can pulse with my children and Converse with them. I can keep walking, and they can do one or two laps with me, and they can sit under the Tent that we set up and work on what we just discussed. I can do this one child at a time and cycle through my children while the other children are located at the lot under the Tent. I would be able to converse in a given lap, I will be able to pray in a given lap, I would be able to listen to scripture in a given lap, it would even be possible to play audio Bible and deep listening on Pathfinder while lapping to facilitate meditation.


## benefits - spaces targeted 
S1O3 - members strengthened via walking
S6O6 - D6 training via intermittent laps and sitting in shade of tent to study
S7- conscience via prayer lapping

## tools 
- nice pop-up tent that pops up super fast, fully shades, nearly fully encloses 
- portable, foldable chairs
- charged phones, tablets, devices
- books writing implements if necessary 
- Pathfinder

Scripture/Torah and scribal priesthood enterprise/ Teacher, Text of commands to perform as an enterprise is doomed to fail.

 Messiah came to destroy the instructor / enforcer model. He supercedes this.

This condemns rabbinical judaism.
This condemns Catholicism .
This condemns protestantism.

Messiah alone is the only Father & Instructor ON EARTH! (via the possessing speaking anointing life giving Spirit of Messiah alone)

comments.body: There is no better way to do this enterprise (against the argument of Christians)

The argument of grace us works, and depicting the old covenant as works and the new covenant is grace keeps the teaching and enforcement enterprise going.

It assuages the refusal to let messiah be the only human teacher on the earth,

substance on earth

A vague ill-formed view of Holy Spirit fosters  the ability of old enterprise models to keep people from living out that Yeshua is the only human teacher for us on the earth.

The Spirit of Yeshua the Messiah (rightly defined as the only human instructor on the EARTH) is the center of the gospel lived out.
Yeshua dethroned the human authority chief -instructor / chief-enforcer model by merit of an indestructible life (circa Hebrews)
The Torah vs Gospel arguments are central, but they are recouched and repositioned to obfuscate the real target according to Jeremiah 31: humans instructing humans.

the seat of Moses was never meant to be dethroned or reoccupied by Yeshua. just like the marriage of Yeshua and the church was never meant to get into the Earthly marriage bed of Lee and joshua. the two coexist alongside each other. reflection and substance are not at odds.

the author of Hebrews seems to understand this very well when he says that the Messiah has no right to change the levitical priesthood because he is not a descendant of Aaron nor from the tribe of Levi but rather a descendant of Judah and from the tribe of Judah.

being entrusted with a body of commands, being responsible to interpret those commands, being responsible to instruct and enforce those commands. this is the Enterprise that the Messiah came to supersede and overrule. when the Supreme Court overrules a lower circuit, the lower circuit does not cease to exist. if there are a bunch of lower circuits that are disconnected, and then a change in the body of organization happens so that there is now a supreme court instituted above those lower circuits, those lower circuits do not cease to exist, they are reconstituted around the Supreme Court that is above them. Yeshua came to attack the command Enterprise this way: by going above their pay grade and forcing them to reconstitute beneath him by going above them. not by destroying them. not by abrogating them.

does Yeshua share the responsibility of instructing with disciples? according to Matthew 18 He seems to. but this too is tongue-in-cheek. because he possesses each instructor. the entrustment is a partnership between the Holy Spirit of Yeshua and that individual. and so far as that human partner is in step with the spirit that possesses him, he is able to share in the work of instructing the other. to the degree he is not in step with the spirit, he has no right at all to direct another disciple. at no point could one of the 12 try to teach one of the other 12 while you feel it was walking among them.
at no point could one of the 12 try to teach one of the other 12 while you feel it was walking among them.

Leviticus 15:16 â€œ â€˜And if an emission of semen goes out from anyone, then he shall wash all of his body with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:17 And any garment and anything leather on which is an emission of semen shall be washed with water, and it shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:18 If there is a woman with whom a man lies down and there is an emission of semen, then they shall wash themselves with water, and they shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:19 â€œ â€˜And when a woman is menstruating, her body fluid discharge occurs in her body; for seven days she shall be in her menstruation, and any person who touches her shall become unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:20 And anything upon which she lies down during her menstruation shall become unclean, and anything upon which she sits shall become unclean.



Leviticus 15:21 And any person who touches her bed must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:22 And any person who touches any object on which she sat must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:23 And if it is on the bed or on the object on which she sits, at his touching it he becomes unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:24 And if a man indeed lies with her and her menstruation occurs on him, then he shall be unclean for seven days, and any bed on which he lies down becomes unclean.



Leviticus 15:25 â€œ â€˜And when a woman discharges a body fluid consisting of her blood for many days, but not at the time of her menstruation, or when she discharges in addition to her menstruation, all the days of her unclean body fluid discharge she shall become unclean as in the days of her menstruation.



Leviticus 15:26 Any bed on which she lies during all the days of her body fluid discharge shall become for her as her bed of menstruation, and any object on which she sits becomes unclean as her menstruationâ€™s uncleanness.



Leviticus 15:27 And any person who touches them becomes unclean, and he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:28 â€œ â€˜And if she is clean from her body fluid discharge, then she shall count for herself seven days, and afterward she becomes clean.



Leviticus 15:29 And on the eighth day she shall take for herself two turtledoves or two young doves, and she shall bring them to the priest at the tent of assemblyâ€™s entrance.



Leviticus 15:30 And the priest shall sacrifice the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and so the priest shall make atonement for her before Yahweh from her unclean body fluid discharge.â€™

(21 verses)

Matthew 18:15 â€œNow if your brother sins against you, go correct him between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.



Matthew 18:16 But if he does not listen, take with you in addition one or two others, so that by the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter may be established.



Matthew 18:17 And if he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. But if he refuses to listen to the church also, let him be to you as a Gentile and a tax collector.



Matthew 18:18 â€œTruly I say to you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will be released in heaven.



Matthew 18:19 Again, truly I say to you that if two of you agree on earth about any matter that they ask, it will be done for them from my Father who is in heaven.



Matthew 18:20 For where two or three are gathered in my name, I am there in the midst of them.â€



Matthew 18:21 Then Peter came up to him and said, â€œLord, how many times will my brother sin against me and I will forgive him? Up to seven times?â€



Matthew 18:22 Jesus said to him, â€œI do not say to you up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven!



Matthew 18:23 â€œFor this reason the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a manâ€”a kingâ€”who wanted to settle accounts with his slaves.



Matthew 18:24 And when he began to settle them, someone was brought to him who owed ten thousand talents.



Matthew 18:25 And because he did not have enough to repay it, the master ordered him to be sold, and his wife and his children and everything that he had, and to be repaid.



Matthew 18:26 Then the slave threw himself to the ground and began to do obeisance to him, saying, â€˜Be patient with me, and I will pay back everything to you!â€™



Matthew 18:27 So the master of that slave, because he had compassion, released him and forgave him the loan.



Matthew 18:28 But that slave went out and found one of his fellow slaves who owed him a hundred denarii, and taking hold of him, he began to choke him, saying, â€˜Pay back everything that you owe!â€™



Matthew 18:29 Then his fellow slave threw himself to the ground and began to implore him, saying, â€˜Be patient with me and I will repay you!â€™



Matthew 18:30 But he did not want to, but rather he went and threw him into prison until he would repay what was owed.



Matthew 18:31 So when his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were extremely distressed, and went and reported to their master everything that had happened.



Matthew 18:32 Then his master summoned him and said to him, â€˜Wicked slave! I forgave you all that debt because you implored me!



Matthew 18:33 Should you not also have shown mercy to your fellow slave as I also showed mercy to you?â€™



Matthew 18:34 And because he was angry, his master handed him over to the merciless jailers until he would repay everything that was owed.



Matthew 18:35 So also my heavenly Father will do to you, unless each of you forgives his brother from your hearts!â€
