body:
Leviticus 14:33 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,



Leviticus 14:34 â€œWhen you come into the land of Canaan, which I am about to give to you as your possession, and I put mildew in a house in the land of your possession,



Leviticus 14:35 then the one who owns the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, â€˜It appears to me that an infection is in the house.â€™



Leviticus 14:36 And the priest shall issue a command, and they shall clear out the house before the priest comes to examine the infection, so that all that is in the house might not become unclean; and afterward the priest shall go to examine the house.



Leviticus 14:37 And he shall examine the infection, and if the infection on the houseâ€™s wall has yellowish-green or reddish spots and its appearance is deeper than the surface of the wall,



Leviticus 14:38 then the priest shall go out from the house to the houseâ€™s entrance, and he shall confine the house for seven days.



Leviticus 14:39 And the priest shall return on the seventh day, and he shall examine the infection, and if the infection has spread on the houseâ€™s wall,



Leviticus 14:40 the priest shall issue a command and they shall remove the stones on which is the infection, and they shall throw them outside the city on an unclean place.



Leviticus 14:41 Then they shall scrape off the plaster from all around the house, and they shall pour out the plaster, which they scraped off, outside the city on an unclean place.



Leviticus 14:42 And they shall take other stones, and they shall put them in place of those stones, and they shall take other plaster, and they shall replaster the house.



Leviticus 14:43 â€œBut if the infection should return and it breaks out in the house after they have removed the stones and after scraping off the plaster of the house and after it has been replastered,



Leviticus 14:44 then the priest shall come, and he shall examine the infection, and if the infection has spread in the house, it is a destructive mildew in the houseâ€”it is unclean.



Leviticus 14:45 So he shall break down the house, its stones and its wood and all of the houseâ€™s plaster, and he shall bring it all outside the city to an unclean place.



Leviticus 14:46 And the person who enters into the house during all the days that he confined it shall become unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 14:47 And the person who sleeps in the house must wash his garments, and the person who eats in the house shall wash his garments.



Leviticus 14:48 â€œAnd if the priest comes again and examines the house and if the infection has not spread in the house after being replastered, then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the infection is healed.



Leviticus 14:49 And he shall take two birds and cedar wood and a crimson thread and hyssop to cleanse the house;



Leviticus 14:50 and he shall slaughter the first bird over fresh water on a clay vessel.



Leviticus 14:51 Then he shall take the cedar wood and the hyssop and the crimson thread and the living bird, and he shall dip them in the slaughtered birdâ€™s blood and in the fresh water, and he shall spatter them on the house seven times.



Leviticus 14:52 Thus he shall purify the house with the birdâ€™s blood and with the fresh water and with the living bird and with the cedar wood and with the hyssop and with the crimson thread.



Leviticus 14:53 And he shall send the living bird outside the city into the open field; and so he shall make atonement for the house, and it shall be clean.



Leviticus 14:54 â€œThis is the instruction for any infectious skin disease and for the diseased area of skin,



Leviticus 14:55 and for a mildew of the garment and for the house,



Leviticus 14:56 and for the swelling and for the epidermal eruption and for the spot,



Leviticus 14:57 to teach when something is unclean and when something is clean. This is the regulation of the infectious skin disease.â€



Leviticus 15:1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,



Leviticus 15:2 â€œSpeak to the Israelites, and you shall say to them, â€˜Any man when a fluid discharge occurs from his body, his fluid discharge is unclean.



Leviticus 15:3 And this becomes his uncleanness in his fluid discharge: whether his body secretes his fluid discharge or his body blocks his fluid discharge, it is his uncleanness.



Leviticus 15:4 Any bed upon which the person who discharges lies down becomes unclean, and any object upon which he sits becomes unclean.



Leviticus 15:5 And anyone who touches his bed must wash his garments and shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until evening.



Leviticus 15:6 And the person who sits on the object upon which the person who discharges has sat must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:7 And the person who touches the body of the person who discharges must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:8 And if the person who discharges spits on one who is clean, then that one shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:9 And any saddle upon which the person who discharges rides becomes unclean.



Leviticus 15:10 And any person who touches anything that happened to be under him becomes unclean until the evening, and the person who carries them must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:11 And anyone whom the person who discharges might touch without rinsing off his hands with water shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.



Leviticus 15:12 But a clay vessel that the person who discharges touches must be broken, and any wood object must be rinsed with water.



Leviticus 15:13 â€œ â€˜And when the person who discharges becomes clean from his body fluid discharge, he shall count for himself seven days for his cleansing; then he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash his body with fresh water, and he shall be clean.



Leviticus 15:14 Then on the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtledoves or two young doves, and he shall come before Yahweh at the tent of assemblyâ€™s entrance, and he shall give them to the priest.



Leviticus 15:15 And the priest shall sacrifice one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and so the priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh from his body fluid discharge.


GOSPEL READING
Matthew 17:14-18:14
(28 verses)

Matthew 17:14 And when they came to the crowd, a man approached him, kneeling down before him



Matthew 17:15 and saying, â€œLord, have mercy on my son, because he has seizures and suffers severely, for often he falls into the fire and often into the water.



Matthew 17:16 And I brought him to your disciples, and they were not able to heal him.â€



Matthew 17:17 And Jesus answered and said, â€œO unbelieving and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to me!â€



Matthew 17:18 And Jesus rebuked him, and the demon came out of him and the boy was healed from that hour.



Matthew 17:19 Then the disciples approached Jesus privately and said, Why were we not able to expel it?â€



Matthew 17:20 And he said to them, â€œBecause of your little faith. For truly I say to you, if you have faith like a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, â€˜Move from here to there,â€™ and it will move, and nothing will be impossible for you.â€



Matthew 17:22 Now as they were gathering in Galilee, Jesus said to them, â€œThe Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men,



Matthew 17:23 and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.â€ And they were extremely distressed.



Matthew 17:24 Now when they arrived in Capernaum, the ones who collected the double drachma tax came up to Peter and said, â€œDoes your teacher not pay the double drachma tax?â€



Matthew 17:25 He said, â€œYes.â€ And when he came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, saying, â€œWhat do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect tolls or taxesâ€”from their own sons, or from foreigners?â€



Matthew 17:26 And when he said, â€œFrom foreigners,â€ Jesus said to him, â€œThen the sons are free.



Matthew 17:27 But so that we do not give offense to them, go out to the sea, cast a line with a hook, and take the first fish that comes up. And when you open its mouth, you will find a four-drachma coin. Take that and give it to them for me and you.â€



Matthew 18:1 At that time the disciples came up to Jesus, saying, â€œWho then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?â€



Matthew 18:2 And calling a child to himself, he had him stand in their midst



Matthew 18:3 and said, â€œTruly I say to you, unless you turn around and become like young children, you will never enter into the kingdom of heaven!



Matthew 18:4 Therefore whoever humbles himself like this child, this person is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven,



Matthew 18:5 and whoever welcomes one child such as this in my name welcomes me.



Matthew 18:6 But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him that a large millstone be hung on his neck and he be drowned in the depths of the sea.



Matthew 18:7 Woe to the world because of causes for stumbling, for it is a necessity that causes for stumbling come; nevertheless, woe to the person through whom the cause for stumbling comes.



Matthew 18:8 And if your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it from you! It is better for you to enter into life crippled or lame than, having two hands or two feet, to be thrown into the eternal fire!



Matthew 18:9 And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it from you! It is better for you to enter into life one-eyed than, having two eyes, to be thrown into fiery hell!



Matthew 18:10 â€œSee to it that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that their angels in heaven constantly see the face of my Father who is in heaven.



Matthew 18:12 What do you think? If a certain man has a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go and look for the one that wandered away?



Matthew 18:13 And if he happens to find it, truly I say to you that he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine that did not wander away.



Matthew 18:14 In the same way it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones perish.

body:
It is the LIE. It is the lie in Ephesians 4. It doesn't matter if they are fully committed to the role of playing the role of the LIE, it is still the LIE, there is still the truth, there is still the real them. The real them is summoned out of the tomb by the voice of Yeshua. If they obey his voice if they are taught by him and hear his voice they will walk as and cause others to experience the truth created in Messiah Yeshua, the real them.

I can detect it's not who they really are by merit of knowing what love is. Love has no fear in it. Love is not arrogant. Love is not angry. So when I see arrogance as a relational configuration, I know I'm not dealing with love, I know there is fear, I know there is masking, I know I'm not dealing with the real person. When first John says that Messiah died as the atonement not only for us, but also as the atonement for the entire world, I now have to shift the source of Truth and shift my understanding of who gets to be the authority of what counts as a real person. Yeshua received all authority in heaven and on Earth, so he becomes the final authority on who a real person is. The truth, the true person is ontologically anchored in the human, Yeshua the Messiah now. This means Yeshua gets to be the ontological source of what a true person is or who the real person in front of me is. It doesn't matter if the person in front of me is a disciple or lost. All persons that are in front of me, the real them is now only found in and through the human Yeshua the Messiah. The gospel is the word becoming human, but also, the word reconstituting humanity through the incarnation, the cross and death, the resurrection and Ascension, and the descension at Pentecost into humanity of the word, Yeshua the Messiah.

Practically this means I can reach for someone's heart when I see arrogance, and I can confidently say, this is not really you. There's fear here. I want to know the real you. The real you is worth knowing. This may not work the first time. This may not work the second time. This may not work the first 20 times. Some people, especially abused people, are especially committed to playing the role of the LIE. To the degree that you're having trouble breaking through, is proportional to the degree of the bear pain and suffering that they endured in trying to be human under their abuse. Some people's commitment to the LIE, in some areas of their life, are like four and a half feet high chain link fences, that you spit on your hands for and hop over. Some people's commitment to the LIE, are walls that appear to reach to the heavens. And this instance they may need to have a Jericho experience. And you may feel as stupid as Israelites commanded to wake up in the morning and March around and impenetrable City. But you can be confident that this is not the real person in front of you.

It may be maddening, it may cause you to doubt, their commitment to the role may be like the most eerie method actor you can imagine. You may be driven to the point of saying maybe there is no one else in there. You may entertain narratives that it is not the LIE, they are in fact this anger or this arrogance. But we have to understand that if we are driven to that point, we have to understand we are sinning not against just the person, but we have to understand we are sinning against Jesus Christ. We have to understand what we are saying is Yeshua is a lie, and he did not in fact die for all of humanity. Yeshua did not in fact stand in place for all of Adam. We are creating small print claws to go with our gospel, an exception clause that says Jesus represents all of humanity and reconstitutes them in himself, except for this one person who is especially arrogant. 

This is not the time to entertain lies. That will only make their commitment stronger, and you will unwittingly be another voice that parallels their abuse. This is the time to be forceful, powerful and potent. This is the time to be immovably forward driving, indomitable. Continue with this kind of forcefulness saying this is not the real you, I want to know the real you. B a tank for the gospel. Deem Yeshua faithful. Know that when you move ahead saying this, he will not leave you or forsake you, his spirit his wind his new creation wings are hovering over this situation. Even if it is a situation that will take hours, days, weeks, months, years.
title: Arrogance is a mask. "You're not letting me know you" it is "not" them, not the truth created in Christ Jesus, just as much as angry man is not the truth.

# An argument or parable of an ontological Trinity of sorts 

- a Trinity of experience:
     - God beyond experience the father 
     - God in the local outer experience the son 
     - God in the inner experience the spirit

- Immanuel = God with you = the word (before breathed in, dialectically between father # beyond and Spirit, WITHIN, once breathed in)
- WITHout us (F), WITH us (Sn), WITHin us (St)
- meta/with, there was never a "time"/"moment" the Word was not WITH [the] God (the Father)
- coterminous ontologies(y)
- the number 3 here is vindicated from my prior arguments regarding the arbitrariness of enlisting the number three. This would be a logical cosmological argument for always three, even in the multiverse
- is there God outside of my experience, is there God that is unexperienceable?

body:
1. Full Text	1
1.1. Exodus	1
1.2. Deuteronomy	3
2. Verse Translations	5
2.1. Verse ex.20.1& deut.5.4	5
2.1.1. Bilingual translations and harmony	5
2.1.2. Dynamic Translation	5
2.1.2.2. Dynamic	6

Goal
As opposed to a dynamic translation which will be very fun to make in the future, we are going to be working on the Euphrates version. A dynamic translation is supposed to be poetical and still clever and higher prose . It is supposed to be a work of literature that makes entendres and linguistical Force of the source language available in the target language to readers.  In contrast we need a super simple, filled out version. I need to enumerate what I mean by filled out.  when I say filled out I actually am referring to supply information. What information is to be supplied in the Euphrates version? Simplified semantical background information that would make misinterpretation of the intended function in the source language impossible, or nearly impossible. There is a lot left to be said in peer-to-peer vernacular language. So much lies between the lines. Vernacular peer-to-peer communication by its very nature is intended to be constructed via consistent use of shorthand speech. While this is incredibly convenient for real time spoken peer-to-peer communication, this is problematic for reconstructing written language that is then to be enacted in a multidimensional complex context. Without supplying more semantical Source language background information, the space between the words will end up being supplied anachronistically through the eisegesis of the present-day listener.  therefore this version will necessarily be much longer. In the overly dyadic paradigm that dominates current biblical translation models, this will necessarily be termed as â€œDynamic equivalenceâ€ . However a formal equivalence translation that is uncoupled with semantical study of the target language will necessarily lend its products to the blindly unscrutinizing anachronistic suppositions of the linguistically uninformed. Scribes are necessary.  scribes ought to be Servants of the  weak. The idea that ascribe would sit on an ivory Tower and use their higher levels of information to make the text more opaque and more inaccessible is satanic, demonic, and deserving of Wrath.  on the contrary, scribes are supposed to do the difficult dangerous highly skilled work of the ancient  miner. They are supposed to carefully climb and to unlit cracks that no man or beast travels into to find precious gems and bring them up safely to be shared and put in the hands of Toddlers and Solomon's kingdom.  Therefore the Euphrates translation  will be written in a prose that is simple enough for small children to understand. But it will be padded with supplied information in order to communicate the intended semantical thrust of the source language.    so from a pragmatic standpoint that would mean for every one sentence in the source language if we're going to create a philosophy of translation for the Euphrates version, it may require 8 to 12 sentences to appropriately translate and Harry in semantical information that is lacking in the source language. This is not paraphrase. This is additional, lexically commentating material. It will be subject to the subjectivity of me the translator. If the sentence is surprising, so too are all of the products of any translation philosophy subject to the translator. This is true whether one adults a theory of translation of formal equivalence or a theory of translation of dynamic equivalence. In fact the attempt to cite a theory of translation as a means of validating the product, is just another faint to hide the reality of the subjectivity of the translator. God is not ashamed of subjectivity. He has not entrusted his authority to a book. Is entrusted his authority to the human Messiah, and all of the tax collectors whores and losers that that Messiah has called himself.  However, there is Merit to questioning anyone's approach, including mine. There is Merit to questioning established approaches, so how much more when it comes to questioning Innovative and new approaches. I'm open to questioning. I myself have questions that are unanswered regarding this translation approach. Mainly what is a translation? Is mine a hybrid of translating and commentating? Has there ever been a translation that is not itself commentating? A word to word formal equivalents target language translation is an imaginary Impossible Dream. And yet, I am not hiding myself behind my translation and I want to be scrutinized as someone who is adding additional information. Is this a translation novel? Should we call it a creative work of literature? I'm open to it being called a creative work of literature, for so to are hymns and songs and spiritual  Psalms. The Holy Spirit has had no problem coupling with creativity. There is no threat to God by partnering with a creative human. I do not know what this translation is ontologically within the landscape of translation. Therefore let us move on and speak of the goals. The goal will be that a small girl with Down Syndrome with a light handle on pigeon talk would be readily able to step into a movie like internal visualization of the words being spoken and read to her. The goal will be more about the movie that she forms inside of her mind then about the exactitude of particular words in the translation itself. For this reason this translation is primarily an instrument like a vehicle, instead of an instrument that is likened to a destination. The destination will remain unseen, for it is intended to take place in the mind of a little girl Down syndrome. The goal will be that her mind movie will be just a semantically accurate and faithful to the ancient oracles as that generated by an erudite philological professor. 
Distinctives of this translation:
The word hiney, which means behold, or see, or hearken will be a metaphorical  Guiding Light for this translation. There will be inserted action words into our translation like Imagine This. This Will necessarily be redactive and intrusive, just as an instruction manual is intrusive to someone who is kinesthetically overcharged and impatient.  there will be overly supplied descriptors and descriptions that would necessarily step into the dangerous Zone of positing something that wasn't there in the first place:  eisegesis.  I actually want to mark my intrusive attempts at  eisegesis ( maybe I will do this with coloring or italics or some other textual formatting mechanism). 
It is a mind movie manual; it is more like a script with production notes and attached storyboards. The script is a dynamical translation of the original. The supplied are the production notes and storyboard pictures and annotations.

body:
TORAH READING
Leviticus 14:21 - 14:32
Tazria-Metzora | (12 verses)

Leviticus 14:21 â€œBut if he is poor and he cannot afford it, then he shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering as a wave offering to make atonement for himself and one-tenth of an ephah of finely milled flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, and a log of oil,



Leviticus 14:22 and two turtledoves or two young doves that he can afford, and one shall be a sin offering and the other a burnt offering.



Leviticus 14:23 And he shall bring them to the priest at the tent of assemblyâ€™s entrance before Yahweh on the eighth day for his cleansing.



Leviticus 14:24 And the priest shall take the male lamb for the guilt offering and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before Yahweh;



Leviticus 14:25 and he shall slaughter the male lamb of the guilt offering, and the priest shall take some of the guilt offeringâ€™s blood, and he shall put it on the right earâ€™s lobe of the one who presents himself for cleansing and on his right handâ€™s thumb and on his right footâ€™s big toe.



Leviticus 14:26 Then the priest shall pour out some of the oil on his own left palm,



Leviticus 14:27 and with his right finger the priest shall spatter some of the oil that is on his left palm seven times before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:28 Then the priest shall put some of the oil that is on his palm on the right earâ€™s lobe of the one who presents himself for cleansing and on his right handâ€™s thumb and on his right footâ€™s big toe on the place of the guilt offeringâ€™s blood.



Leviticus 14:29 And the remaining oil that is on the priestâ€™s palm he shall put on the head of the one who presents himself for cleansing to make atonement for him before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:30 And he shall sacrifice one of the turtledoves or the young doves that he can afford,



Leviticus 14:31 even what he can afford, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering in addition to the grain offering, and the priest shall make atonement for the one who presents himself for cleansing before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:32 This is the regulation of the one on whom is an infectious skin disease who cannot afford the cost for his cleansing.â€


GOSPEL READING
Matthew 16:21-17:13
(21 verses)

Matthew 16:21 From that time on Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised on the third day.



Matthew 16:22 And Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, God forbid, Lord! This will never happen to you!â€



Matthew 16:23 But he turned around and said to Peter, â€œGet behind me, Satan! You are a cause for stumbling to me, because you are not intent on the things of God, but the things of people!â€



Matthew 16:24 Then Jesus said to his disciples, â€œIf anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.



Matthew 16:25 For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life on account of me will find it

Matthew 16:26 For what will a person be benefited if he gains the whole world but forfeits his life? Or what will a person give in exchange for his life?



Matthew 16:27 For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and at that time he will reward each one according to what he has done.



Matthew 16:28 Truly I say to you, that there are some of those standing here who will never experience death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.â€



Matthew 17:1 And after six days Jesus took along Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.



Matthew 17:2 And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothing became bright as the light.



Matthew 17:3 And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with him.



Matthew 17:4 So Peter answered and said to Jesus, â€œLord, it is good that we are here! If you want, I will make here three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah.â€



Matthew 17:5 While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and behold, a voice from the cloud said, â€œThis is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased. Listen to him!â€



Matthew 17:6 And when the disciples heard this, they fell down on their faces and were extremely frightened.



Matthew 17:7 And Jesus came and touched them and said, â€œGet up and do not be afraid.â€



Matthew 17:8 And when they lifted up their eyes they saw no one except himâ€”Jesus alone.



Matthew 17:9 And as they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them saying, â€œTell no one the vision until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.â€



Matthew 17:10 And the disciples asked him, saying, â€œThen why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?â€



Matthew 17:11 And he answered and said, â€œElijah indeed is coming, and will restore all things.



Matthew 17:12 But I say to you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but did with him whatever they wanted. In the same way also the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.â€



Matthew 17:13 Then the disciples understood that he had spoken to them about John the Baptist.

- Isa 57:15 LEB For thus says the high and lofty one who resides forever, and whose name is holy:  â€œI reside in a high and holy place,  and with the contrite and humble of spirit,  to revive the spirit of the humble,  and to revive the heart of the contrite.
- *[[Gen 6:5]]* And Yahweh saw that the evil of humankind was great upon the earth, and every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was always only evil.
- Gen 6:6 LEB And Yahweh regretted that he had made humankind on the earth, and he was grieved in his heart.
- Jer 17:9 LEB The heart is deceitful more than anything else, and it is disastrous. Who can understand it?
- Psa 101:1 LEB Of David. A psalm. I will sing of loyal love and justice; I will sing praises to you, O Yahweh.Psa 101:2 LEB I will give attention to the way of integrity. When will you come to me? I will walk in the integrity of my heart in the midst of my house.Psa 101:3 LEB I will not set before my eyes any wicked thing. I hate the work of those who fall away; it will not cling to me.Psa 101:4 LEB A perverse heart will depart from me; I will not know evil.
- Mat 15:19 LEB For from the heart come evil plans, mu rder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, abusive speech.
- Luk 6:45 LEB The good person out of the good treasury of his heart brings forth good, and the evil person out of his evil treasury brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
- Mat 6:19 LEB Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and consuming insect note destroy and where thieves break in and steal, 20  but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor consuming insect note destroy and where thieves do not break in or steal. 21  For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
- Psa 24:4 LEB He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart,  who does not lift up his soul to falseness,  and does not swear deceitfully.
- Psa 22:14 LEB I am poured out like water,  and all my bones are out of joint.  My heart is like wax;  it is melted within me.
- Deu 6:5 LEB And you shall love Yahweh your God with all of your heart and with all of your soul and with all of your might.Deu 6:6 LEB And these words that I am commanding you today shall be on your heart.
- Deu 1:28 LEB Where can we go up? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, saying, â€œThe people are greater and taller than we are, and there are great fortified cities reaching up to heaven, and we saw the sons of the Anakites living there.â€
- Pro 20:5 LEB Deep waters are like purpose in the heart of a man,  and a man of understanding will draw it out.
- Psa 78:72 LEB And he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,  and led them by the skillfulness of his hands.

comments.body:
> Exodus 16:4 LEB And Yahweh said to Moses, â€œLook, I am going to rain down for you bread from the heavens, and the people will go out and gather enough for the day on its day; in that way I will test them: Will they go according to my law or not?

This is also an odd connection to the idea that of not being led into temptation as to whether or not they will walk in you always Torah tested tempted tried here by Yahweh

That exodus verse is a dope parallel to yeshuas instruction on prayer. Definitely want to go and chew on that. 

I'm of a mind now after looking into epiousion that although "daily" is an insufficient or lacking translation it is at least part of what is in view. It feels now like a very superficial read through which we miss out on a lot of the nuance and depth that's implied with something like superessential or supersubstantial.

body:
Did John reflect on, employ Lord's prayer as an overarching scaffolding for how he witnesses to Yeshua the Messiah?

Does this explain some of the empaheses of John in contradistinction to the synoptics? By this later time, he would be focused on teaching others to obey all that the Messiah commanded, teaching it to the nations and baptizing them.

### features
- use of "father" as title for God more than synoptics 
- by proxy, greater use of title "son"
- greater explanation emphasis on the name of Yeshua invoked being the mechanism of requests being granted by the father (asking for things in his name, this is essentially absent from the synoptics apart from healing and signs performed in the name of Yeshua )
- greatest emphasis on Divine name and Earth Yahweh intermediary language of all - Gospels.
- greatest emphasis on above and below heaven versus Earth language 
- greatest episode on doing the will of the father and the will of the father being performed 
- only gospel to directly correlate bread from heaven being his yeshuas flesh and blood and the will of God about bread being connected 
- the need for bread that will fill bread for eating
- Satan as ruler of world / concept of world/ as source of evil and temptation

body: lately I have had the thought that I should make my movements in scripture more publicly available more available to the household and transparent. even if no one joins me that I would go ahead with it alone. it is boring good fruit in my heart to do this and in my mind. as I think about it I realize that doing the work of Torah doing the work of Ezra 7:10is the work of each individual disciple and it would be helpful to have an overseer while people are pursuing memorization and searching through the Torah themselves almost like a Woodshop class overseer each student is kind of doing their own project but the instructor here is only giving guidance and equipping the individuals to do their workmaybe this is why synagogues are called a house of study and this is more reminiscent of seeing pairs of young Jews study talmud by working verse through verse arguing with each other in other words the way that Jews study talmud is you don't study alone, you need a partner, and you systematically work through Section by section of the talmud with the express goal that you ask questions that are supposed to be argumentative and answer back with content and questions that are supposed to be argumentative

comments.body: I set up shop and prepare the workshop space set up so to speak, the house of searching the house of study. you come prepared to pursue your own study. but you can use my equipment, and you can call on me for guidance. but it is your study. so instead of you doing my thing, you do your own thing in the space where I have already set up shop

if Yeshua was attempting to position himself as above the contemporaneous teachers of the Torah, the scribes in the Pharisees, was he not also attempting to circumvent or alter their conception of synagogue?

consider the response to the Torah on the mount in Matthew

Matthew 7:28-29 LEB 28 And it happened when Jesus finished these words the crowds were amazed at his teaching, 29 because he was teaching them like one who had authority, and not like their scribes.

part of what is being compared is the way that Yeshua is instructing them, versus and against the way that the scribes instruct them. this is helpful to keep in view. the crowds are crowds of Jews. it is not as though they have no one instructing them. they have the scribes instructing them. a question arises: what is the context and the place that they experienced the scribes instructing them? according to Luke 20:46 the scribes are apparently interacting with them in the synagogue. it is a solid reading and good reconstruction of the Gospel to say that if Yeshua was understood to be overhauling instruction he would also be understood to be overhauling synagogue

#### activities that happen in the synagogue according to Yeshua
- instructing Matthew 4:23 Matthew 9:35 John 18:20
- preaching or proclaiming a declaration Mark 1:39 Luke 4:44
- praying Matthew 6:5
- giving alms Matthew 6:2
- possibly seated banquets / celebrations Matthew 23:6
- flogging and communal discipline Matthew 10:17
- reading Luke 4:16
- recognition of communal status John 9:22 John 12:42 John 16:2

here is a helpful word picture: imagine Gandalf encountering the ring but then needing to travel to Gondor to the library to grab Scrolls in order to figure out a practical game plan for what to do with the ring as well as its meaning and history. individual Saints and disciples who have Pursuits like this how to be a husband, how to be a father, how to pray, how to worship, Etc should all be allowed to go into a house of study, be equipped and guided in their individual Pursuit

I appreciate that you've created this platform and it being a more collaborative activity seems necessary for it to keep functioning. 
The role of overseer has some choices concerning study. Assuming it is @joshualinog are you assigning partners, work; or are you expecting that students, disciples are choosing partners, work? Are we asking for partners and others opt in or out?

Perhaps another helpful picture that will resonate with some here. Imagine the bakery as the workshop. The farmers market as a work has been judged as being better by far for partners - chosen work rather than assigned, and the produce of which is for workers over and above the bakery. Bakery as platform. What you're describing seems more like farmers market baking than fulfilling orders for LSG on behalf of the business as such.

> I appreciate that you've created this platform and it being a more collaborative activity seems necessary for it to keep functioning. 

Yes sir

> The role of overseer has some choices concerning study. Assuming it is @joshualinog are you assigning partners, work; or are you expecting that students, disciples are choosing partners, work? Are we asking for partners and others opt in or out

@joemshea I would be the overseer, but technically you can still do wood shop with a substitute teacher :-) 

Is this would be driven by individuals and their individual duty to search out the Torah as a disciple of Yeshua, they would be entirely free to partner up how they wish to opt in and out how they choose, into pick and select the work they want to do. By all means a prudent woodshop student would ask the instructor for recommendations of projects or for tips or even maybe a series of projects for direction, but that would just be to ponder and consider. It is up to the individual

## thoughts
- this is the first mention of scribes and the preamble to discussing the writings and the Torah itself. should it be seen more contextually as comparing the job of teaching the Torah to the contemporaneously accepted teachers of the Torah. in fact this would make more sense of the repeated refrain that will follow which is you have heard it said but I Yeshua say to you . he is not saying you have heard it said in the Torah itself, rather he is saying you have heard it said by your teachers who are the scribes the Pharisees the interpreters of the Torah and the prophets. he may be saying that he as a teacher surpasses them as teachers and he as a teacher is able to make his disciples surpass their current teachers of the Torah the Pharisees.
- semantically there is a commonality between the verb translated as surpass and the verb typically translated as fulfill. they're semantic background is actually connected and there is overlap if you change the translation of the first verb from fulfill to overflow or super abound or become filled or filling or spilling over Circa Isaiah and the knowledge of the glory of Yahweh covering the Earth as the waters cover the Seas
- Yeshua should be heard here as saying he will bring Torah in the cup up to a full cup, up to perfect Torah, doing Torah so that it is not lacking, or very simply, Torah-fullness! this is in fact how the Torah on the mount ends:Matthew 7:23 LEB And then I will say to them plainly, â€˜I never knew you. Depart from me, you who practice lawlessness or torahlessness!â€™ here the opposite of Torah-lessness, is torah**ful**ness
- consider that the word used for surpass is actually used in physical quantity language and is translated as two super abound be left over or abound : Matthew 13:12 LEB For whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have an **abundance**. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
- therefore the translation should be to fill - up past the Pharisees
- this brings up a very practical and simple question: through what means or mechanism or activity does Yeshua intend to bring Torah to its full unlacking state? through what activity does Yeshua intend to bring Torah abundance? the answer is simple through instructing and being an instructor. this is synonymous with being the messiah! the Messiah has come to bring Torah and to be the superlative best instructor. Christians have read this abstractly as having to do with sacrifice. the verse has nothing to do with Yeshua representatively dealing with death, sacrifice, punishment, retribution, or forgiveness. the verse has to do with him functioning as the Messiah, that is as an instructor instructing! this means he understood himself as doing the job to its maximum of instructing others on how to do Torah ! consider this passage in Matthew Matthew 23:8-10 LEB 8 But you are not to be called â€˜Rabbi,â€™ because one is your teacher, and you are all brothers, 9 And do not call anyone your father on earth, for one is your heavenly Father. 10 And do not be called teachers, because one is your teacher, the Christ.Yeshua believed that the Messiah would take over the job of instructing the Torah, not getting rid of it. if he was getting rid of anything, it may be getting rid of the job of the scribes and the Pharisees by overtaking and subsuming their role.

Soooooo....

when you are arguing that the Torah is not for the Gentiles or they are not permitted to take part in torahfulness, you are advancing a pharisele, rabbinical argument. understand that the Messiah was gunning for their function as the soul instructor, and you are advancing the job security of the rabbinical movement and Pharisees by advocating for gentiles having no relationship to Torah. this is a pharisaical and rabbinical scribal argument. Gentiles are not permitted to partake in Torah Praxis and study according to the rabbis apart from conversion and renouncing their Gentile status.

in a way you are continuing the historical argument of the parties that plotted against the Messiah and murdered him in order to maintain position status power influence and direct tutorial roles over the Jewish people Jerusalem and the Torah.

# Word 2 - BLOCK TALK (TEN WORDS translation)
_Hebrew: #140_ 

##  you haven't seen the shape of my face. The fire and the cloud are blocking the shape of my face from your eyes. I'm using them like a veil to cover my face up. so you can't look here and try to see the shape of me. I'm using the fire & the cloud to cover me, and you can't peek through. You can't look that way.

## even though you can't look through the fire and the Dark Cloud I am in right now, don't try to look in other places either to find the shape of my face, and the shape of me. You won't find my shape there either. You won't find the real shape of me anywhere else.
 
 ## I know you can try hard. I know you can make things up and imagine. You can look at things all around you. After you look then you can make up ideas. I know you can create things. You can make those ideas into shapes that you touch and use. You can use those ideas to try to get things. 


## I know you can see a lot with your eyes. I made the seeing place. It's called the Earth. The Earth got three parts, three places.: 1.) **THE TOP PLACE**.  the heavens that are up over you, that's the top place. You can see it high up there. 2.) **THE MIDDLE PLACE**. the land you standing on under the heavens is the middle place. You walking on it and living on it. 3.) **THE BOTTOM PLACE**. The seas under the land, that's the bottom place. You can see it down below.

##  When you looking, you seeing different things in these three places. You seeing other things in the heavens. You seeing other things in the land. You seeing other things in the seas. You looking, but don't think these are your beginning. You don't come from them and you didn't start there. Don't look at all these other shapes in the three places, and then make pairs of father and mother. Don't stare and pair up male and female, mother and father in the top place. Don't try to carve out shapes and come up with fake plans about mothers and fathers you come from. 



## I know when you looking you seeing images. Don't matter if you looking up or down, DON'T, stare at the images, pair the images, call the images mom and dad, and then make images of the images, copies of the copies. This is fake mom and dad! My image is male and female. my one image, NOT your many images is male and female. Your image does not come from these things. You're not from them, they not for you. Don't do it.


## You seeing  so many things in these three places. But you won't find your special job or your beginning story by looking in these three places. You won't find your story and you won't learn who to copy by looking up and staring. Don't look up to them and try to follow them or copy them. Don't copy what you see, and then follow them. 

## when you make these things, these are just ugly shapes and ugly patterns and ugly copies. Don't make these ugly mom and dad, king and queen copies. 

## NONE OF THESE UGLIES:
## No shapes
## No patterns
## No models
## No forms
## No images
## no blueprints.

## DON'T FAKE IT AND MAKE IT UP:
## don't shape it!
##  don't carve it!  
## don't craft it! 
## don't make a model!


## Don't draw these things like you, cuz you not come from them. Don't shape them into boy and girl pairs. Don't craft male and female, mother and father pairs for you to look at down here. Don't stare up at these things, and then make mother and father shapes down here so you can bow down to the shapes you made on the ground. Don't lay yourself beneath them. Don't lay flat and put your nose on the ground in front of them. 

## Don't make them heavy. Don't serve them. Don't try to do things for them. Don't obey them and be their slaves. They're not your masters and you're not their servants. I took you out of the house of slavery! Don't look up to them. They're not your fathers and your mothers. These fake mother and father male and female images didn't come together to make your image. And they didn't join up in a father and mother marriage to make the true image that you are.

# the function of word 2 is attempting to depict Yahweh's face, form, visual presence and appearance NOT simply leaving to go to other Gods ; that's logically baked in via stringency

## concept
The logical flow from word 1 to word 2 to word 3 to word 4 is revealed in preamble of Deuteronomy 4 verses 1 through 7.

- One flows into two two flows into three three flows into four.
- There is a logical progression from discrete point to resulting discrete point.
- the concept of male and female being embedded in the IMAGE of God is revealed in Genesis. the IMAGE of God is connected to his visually perceivable manifestation. This visually perceivable manifestation has MALE & FEMALE embedded into it. 
- There is the additional belief that creation IMAGES/SHADOWS the Creator. This is not simply a monolithic principle, but a repeating, recapitulating principle at work in smaller & smaller spaces & instances in creation. e.g. the earth IMAGES/SHADOWS the heavens. Thus, with the ancients being aware of this principle, the following may seem to be a legitimate endeavor : for humans to attempt to reverse engineer visible creation to perceive/conceptualize/and ENGAGE with the invisible Creator.

# Word 1 - BLOCK TALK (TEN WORDS translation)

_Hebrew: #139_

## 5.6
## 'I am the heaven guy. It's me, Yahweh your God. I, me, not other heaven person, I am Yah your God.  I am THE one heaven person.  I am the person who brought you out of the land of Egypt.  I am the person who brought you out of the house of slavery.  There is no other but me.
## 5.7
## There is no other person for you.  I came first, all others came after.  I come first, all others come later. At the start, at your start, it's only me. I'm the beginning and I'm your source, I'm your starting place. Everything else came after. I'm before everything, before all the others, before all other things.  Only I seeked you and joined myself to you.  I did this to know you.  Me alone knowing you alone.  Only me for only you.  Only you for only me.

## Other gods are not for you, other heaven persons are not for you, you can't have them.  You can only have me.  So don't carry any other gods and don't bring them near me.  Don't put them on my face.  

## my face is hidden from you in this fire, high up on this mountain. you only hear my voice. Down on the ground, where you are, you can only hear me, not see me. You can hear my voice & listen. Listen to me: there is a way to seek my face. there is a right way to look for my face and find my face. don't try to  put a mask that looks like other gods on my face. that's the wrong way. it won't work. my face isn't like their face. I am Yahweh, so don't try to call me by the names of other gods. I'm not like them, so I won't answer when you call me those names.

comments.body:
Does the clause "on my face " constitute an idiom?

it has **multiple**, valid shades of meaning.
It can mean:
- in my presence.
- it can mean before me [, that is in my shrine, with me where I've enshrined myself]
- it seems possible linguistically and historio contextually Within the Exodus wandering narratives that on my face is a shorthand prohibition of the syncretistically depicting Yahweh in accordance with Extant religious depiction. so on my face here would be like a mask. or like another name another title for Yahweh. this may be strange to us but the ancient Israelite who's Paradigm was formed in the ancient Egyptian Empire may have found it suitable to say that another title for Yahweh is Baal.

for example the final word "face" in saying 1 logically leads to the concept of depicting an image of that face which is saying 2.

body:
# overlaps between Isaiah and the gospel narratives in general 


_Originally posted by @joshualinog in https://github.com/joshualinog/scribal.bible/issues/79#issuecomment-2855868895_
title: Overlaps between Isaiah and the gospel narratives in general

body:
Listening to first John 1 in Hebrew, suddenly creates multiple links between Isaianic passages, particularly the servant song, but especially the window of chapters 48 through 55. Was John specifically simplifying isaanic thinking? Was John trying to articulate izanic concepts about the Messiah with simplicity? This seems to correlate with the idea that Isaiah itself is a convoluted obfuscated parabolic take in the vein of Deuteronomy 32 precisely because the clarity provided by the Torah and the Deuteronomy code of law is cast aside by Israel who prefers treachery and obfuscation.

There seem to be very odd keyword overlaps and vocabulary concepts that overlap with repeated usage in Isaiah. Additionally it helps explain some oddities of the way that John depicts Jesus as the light for example in chapter 1. 

# overlaps between 1st John and Isaiah 
### 1 John 1:5-7 LEB 5 And this is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light and there is no darkness in him at all. 6 If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth. 7 But if we walk in the light as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

- Isaiah 9:2 LEB The people **who walked in darkness have seen a great light;  light has shined on those who lived in a land of darkness**.
- Isaiah 50:10-11 LEB 10 Who among you is in fear of Yahweh,  obeys the voice of his servant?  **Who walks in darkness  and has no light,**  trusts in the name of Yahweh  and depends on his God? 11 Look! All of you are kindlers of fire,  who gird yourselves with flaming arrows.  **Walk in the light of your fire,  and among the flaming arrows you have kindled**!  You shall have this from my hand:  you shall lie down in a place of torment.
- Isaiah 49:6 LEB And he says, â€œIt is trivial for you to be a servant for me,  to raise up the tribes of Jacob  and to bring back the preserved of Israel.  **I will give you as a light to the nations,  to be my salvation to the end of the earth.**â€
- Isaiah 42:6-7 LEB 6 â€œI am Yahweh; I have called you in righteousness,  and I have grasped your hand and watched over you;  and **I have given you as a covenant of the people,  as a light of the nations**, 7 to open the blind eyes,  to bring the prisoner out from the dungeon,  those who sit in darkness from the house of imprisonment.
- Isaiah 51:4 LEB â€œListen attentively to me, my people,  and my nation, listen to me!  For a teaching/ TORAH will go out from me, **and I will cause my justice/MISHPAT to rest for a light to the peoples.**

## notes
- Word 3 is the heaven version of word eight and they correspond to each other 
- The vocabulary of word three has enormous overlap with the jealous / zealous husband ritual in numbers 5
- The name is the theophanic representative of Yahweh on the Earth
- The name of Yahweh technically is the husband of the people of Israel 
- receiving the name of a man is connected to marriage in the Tanakh
- yahweh's name is revealed to be El-Qana in Word 3 
- yahweh's name is unpacked in Exodus 34 and proclaimed over Moshe, and reveals that El-Qana, El-Burning Obsession, is the kind of overarching the wrapper container of the Yahweh formula. Said differently, his compassion is driven with burning obsession, his graciousness is driven with burning obsession, his slowness to anger is driven with burning obsession, his loyal love is driven with burning obsession, his faithfulness is driven with burning obsession
- because the name of Yahweh, El-Qana is the theophanic representation of Yahweh, he is depicted as an incarnated strongman warrior, circa Exodus 15. This depiction of him is carried through the tanakh, circa Isaiah 59

Weekly Public Reading
5/3/25
TORAH READING
Leviticus 13:55 - 14:20
Tazria-Metzora | (25 verses)

Leviticus 13:55 And the priest shall examine it after the infection has been washed off, and if the infection has not changed its outward appearance and the infection has not spread, it is unclean; he must burn it in the fire; it is a fungus on its back or on its front.



Leviticus 13:56 But if the priest examines it and if the infection is faded after it has been washed off, then he shall tear it from the garment or from the leather or from the woven material or from the fabric.



Leviticus 13:57 And if it appears again on the garment or on the woven material or on the fabric or on any leather object, it is spreading; you must burn in the fire that which has the infection in it.



Leviticus 13:58 And the garment or the woven material or the fabric or any leather object that he might wash and the infection is removed from them then shall be washed a second time, and it shall be clean.â€



Leviticus 13:59 This is the regulation of the infectious skin disease in the wool garment or the linen or the woven material or the fabric or any leather object to declare it clean or to declare it unclean.



Leviticus 14:1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,



Leviticus 14:2 â€œThis is the regulation of the person afflicted with a skin disease at the time of his cleansing. And he shall be brought to the priest,



Leviticus 14:3 and the priest shall go outside the camp, and the priest shall examine him, and if the skin diseaseâ€™s infection is healed on the afflicted person,



Leviticus 14:4 then the priest shall command, and he shall take two living, clean birds and cedar wood and a crimson thread and hyssop for the one who presents himself for cleansing.



Leviticus 14:5 Then the priest shall command someone to slaughter one bird over fresh water in a clay vessel.



Leviticus 14:6 He must take the living bird and the cedar wood and the crimson thread and the hyssop, and he shall dip them and the living bird in the birdâ€™s blood slaughtered over the fresh water.



Leviticus 14:7 And he shall spatter the blood seven times on the one who presents himself for cleansing from the infectious skin disease, and he shall declare him clean, and he shall send the living bird into the open field.



Leviticus 14:8 Then the one who presents himself for cleansing shall wash his garments, and he shall shave off all his hair, and he shall wash himself in the water; thus he shall be clean, and afterward he shall enter the camp, but he shall stay outside his tent for seven days.



Leviticus 14:9 And then on the seventh day he must shave off all his hairâ€”he must shave his head and his beard and his eyebrows and all the rest of his hairâ€”and he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash his body in the water; thus he shall be clean.



Leviticus 14:10 â€œAnd on the eighth day he must take two male lambs without defect and one ewe-lamb in its first year without defect and three-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour mixed with oil as a grain offering and one log of oil.



Leviticus 14:11 And the priest who cleanses him shall present the man who presents himself for cleansing and these things before Yahweh at the entrance of the tent of assembly.



Leviticus 14:12 Then the priest shall take the one male lamb, and he shall present it as a guilt offering, and the log of oil, and he shall wave them as a wave offering before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:13 And he shall slaughter the male lamb in the place where he slaughters the sin offering and the burnt offering in the sanctuaryâ€™s space, because as the sin offering belongs to the priest, so also the guilt offeringâ€”it is a most holy thing.



Leviticus 14:14 And the priest shall take some of the guilt offeringâ€™s blood, and the priest shall put it on the right earâ€™s lobe of the one who presents himself for cleansing and on his right handâ€™s thumb and on his right footâ€™s big toe.



Leviticus 14:15 And the priest shall take some of the log of oil, and he shall pour it on his left palm;



Leviticus 14:16 and the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is on his left palm, and he shall spatter some of the oil with his finger seven times before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:17 Then the priest shall put some of the remaining oil, which is on his palm, on the right earâ€™s lobe of the one to be cleansed and on his right handâ€™s thumb and on his right footâ€™s big toe, on top of the guilt offeringâ€™s blood.



Leviticus 14:18 And the remaining oil that is on the priestâ€™s palm he shall put on the head of the one who presents himself for cleansing, and the priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh.



Leviticus 14:19 Thus the priest shall sacrifice the sin offering, and he shall make atonement for the one who presents himself for cleansing from his uncleanness, and afterward he shall slaughter the burnt offering



Leviticus 14:20 Then the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar, and the priest shall make atonement for him, and so he shall be clean.


GOSPEL READING
Matthew 15:21-16:20
(39 verses)

Matthew 15:21 And departing from there, Jesus went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon.



Matthew 15:22 And behold, a Canaanite woman from that district came and cried out, saying, â€œHave mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely possessed by a demon!â€



Matthew 15:23 But he did not answer her a word. And his disciples came up and asked him, saying, â€œSend her away, because she is crying out after us!â€



Matthew 15:24 But he answered and said, â€œI was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.â€



Matthew 15:25 But she came and knelt down before him, saying, â€œLord, help me!â€



Matthew 15:26 And he answered and said, â€œIt is not right to take the childrenâ€™s bread and throw it to the dogs!â€



Matthew 15:27 So she said, â€œYes, Lord, for even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masterâ€™s table.â€



Matthew 15:28 Then Jesus answered and said to her, â€œO woman, your faith is great! Let it be done for you as you want.â€ And her daughter was healed from that hour.



Matthew 15:29 And departing from there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee, and he went up on the mountain and was sitting there.



Matthew 15:30 And large crowds came to him, having with them the mute, blind, lame, crippled, and many others, and they put them down at his feet, and he healed them.



Matthew 15:31 So then the crowd was astonished when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they praised the God of Israel.



Matthew 15:32 And Jesus summoned his disciples and said, â€œI have compassion on the crowd, because they have remained with me three days already and do not have anything to eat, and I do not want to send them away hungry lest they give out on the way.â€



Matthew 15:33 And the disciples said to him, â€œWhere in this desolate place can we get so much bread that such a great crowd could be satisfied?â€



Matthew 15:34 And Jesus said to them, â€œHow many loaves do you have?â€ So they said, â€œSeven, and a few little fish.â€



Matthew 15:35 And commanding the crowd to recline for a meal on the ground,



Matthew 15:36 he took the seven loaves and the fish and after he had given thanks, he broke them and began giving them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.



Matthew 15:37 And they all ate and were satisfied, and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, seven baskets full.



Matthew 15:38 Now those who ate were four thousand men, in addition to women and children.



Matthew 15:39 And after he sent away the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.



Matthew 16:1 And when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test him, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.



Matthew 16:2 So he answered and said to them, â€œWhen evening comes you say, â€˜It will be fair weather because the sky is red,â€™



Matthew 16:3 and early in the morning, â€˜Today it will be stormy weather, because the sky is red and darkening.â€™ You know how to evaluate correctly the appearance of the sky, but you are not able to evaluate the signs of the times.



Matthew 16:4 An evil and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, and a sign will not be given to it except the sign of Jonah!â€ And he left them and went away.



Matthew 16:5 And when the disciples arrived at the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.



Matthew 16:6 And Jesus said to them, â€œWatch out for and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees!â€



Matthew 16:7 So they were discussing this among themselves, saying, â€œIt is because we did not take bread.â€



Matthew 16:8 But knowing this, Jesus said, â€œWhy are you discussing among yourselves that you did not take bread, you of little faith?



Matthew 16:9 Do you not yet understand or do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?



Matthew 16:10 Or the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many baskets you took up?



Matthew 16:11 How do you not understand that I did not speak to you about bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees!â€



Matthew 16:12 Then they understood that he did not say to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.



Matthew 16:13 Now when Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he began asking his disciples, saying, â€œWho do people say that the Son of Man is?â€



Matthew 16:14 And they said, Some say John the Baptist, but others Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.â€



Matthew 16:15 He said to them, â€œBut who do you say that I am?â€



Matthew 16:16 And Simon Peter answered and said, â€œYou are the Christ, the Son of the living God!â€



Matthew 16:17 And Jesus answered and said to him, â€œBlessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.



Matthew 16:18 And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overpower it!



Matthew 16:19 I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you release on earth will be released in heaven.â€



Matthew 16:20 Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was the Christ.

Matthew 9:1-38 LEB 1 And getting into a boat, he crossed over and came to his own town. 2 And behold, they brought to him a paralytic lying on a stretcher, and when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, â€œHave courage, child, your sins are forgiven.â€ 3 And behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, â€œThis man is blaspheming!â€ 4 And knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, â€œWhy do you think evil in your hearts? 5 For which is easier to say, â€˜Your sins are forgiven,â€™ or to say, â€˜Get up and walkâ€™? 6 But in order that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,â€ then he said to the paralytic, â€œGet up, pick up your stretcher and go to your home.â€ 7 And he got up and went to his home. 8 But when the crowds saw this, they were afraid and glorified God who had given such authority to men. 9 And as Jesus was going away from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth and said to him, â€œFollow me!â€ And he stood up and followed him. 10 And it happened as he was dining in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners were coming and dining with Jesus and his disciples. 11 And when they saw it, the Pharisees began to say to his disciples, â€œWhy does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?â€ 12 And when he heard it, he said, â€œThose who are healthy do not have need of a physician, but those who are sick. 13 But go and learn what it means, â€œI want mercy and not sacrifice.â€ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.â€ 14 Then the disciples of John approached him, saying, â€œWhy do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?â€ 15 And Jesus said to them, â€œThe bridegroomâ€™s attendants are not able to mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them. But days are coming when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast. 16 But no one puts a patch of unshrunken cloth on an old garment, for its patch pulls away from the garment, and the tear becomes worse. 17 Nor do they put new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wineskins burst and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are destroyed. But they put new wine into new wineskins and both are preserved.â€ 18 As he was saying these things to them, behold, one of the rulers came and knelt down before him, saying, â€œMy daughter has just now died, but come, place your hand on her and she will live!â€ 19 And Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him. 20 And behold, a woman who had been suffering with a hemorrhage twelve years approached from behind and touched the edge of his cloak, 21 for she said to herself, â€œIf only I touch his cloak I will be healed.â€ 22 But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, â€œHave courage, daughter! Your faith has healed you.â€ And the woman was healed from that hour. 23 And when Jesus came into the rulerâ€™s house and saw the flute players and the disorderly crowd, 24 he said, â€œGo away, because the girl is not dead, but is sleeping.â€ And they ridiculed him. 25 But when the crowd had been sent out, he entered and took her hand, and the girl got up. 26 And this report went out into that whole region. 27 And as Jesus was going away from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, â€œHave mercy on us, Son of David!â€ 28 And when he came into the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, â€œDo you believe that I am able to do this?â€ They said to him, â€œYes, Lord.â€ 29 Then he touched their eyes, saying, â€œAccording to your faith let it be done for you.â€ 30 And their eyes were opened, and Jesus sternly warned them, saying, â€œSee that no one finds out.â€ 31 But they went out and spread the report about him in that whole region. 32 Now as they were going away, behold, they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak. 33 And after the demon had been expelled, the one who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were astonished, saying, â€œThis has never been seen before in Israel!â€ 34 But the Pharisees were saying, â€œBy the ruler of demons he expels the demons!â€ 35 And Jesus was going around all the towns and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness. 36 And when he saw the crowds, he had compassion for them, because they were weary and dejected, like sheep that did not have a shepherd. 37 Then he said to his disciples, â€œThe harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. 38 Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest that he send out workers into his harvest.â€
